loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 45-year-old married woman, mother of five children. She opened a grocery store in 2008 to help her family in improving their income. Mariam has 14 years of experience in this field and is well known in the region. Her convenience store is well known in the region, because she has worked hard to keep it well stocked with almost all of the customers' needs.

Mariam is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy special requested products for summer and the Ramadan period. This is Mariam's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; her previous loan helped a lot in improving her business, in addition to her family's situation.

She is working hard to keep on expanding her business categories and adding newly released brands to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy specially requested products for summer and the Ramadan period.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 39-year-old married man, father of three children. He has been working at repairing car bodies for seven years.

Husein applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a used car to fix it up and sell it. This will bring him extra profit and will increase his income. This will also be a good experience to start selling used cars to widen his business.

Husein is a hard worker, well known in the region. This is his second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower; his previous loan helped a lot in improving his tools for better results. He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy a used car to fix it up and sell it

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en:
Deogratius is a client from Kitagwenda, in one of the farthest districts from the city. He is married and has many dependants that he takes care of. He deals in assorted consumer goods. Deogratius is currently in his third loan cycle. The client has borrowed money to restock more items in his shop because the demand for them has increased. He is facing stiff competition from other retailers and would like his shop to be a one stop centre for his customers. He wants  his customers to get all they want from his shop. 

Deogratius is planning to construct his own commercial building and stop renting. He is also planning to buy a banana plantation for food security for his extend family. He is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: To stock more products for sale

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is 56 years old; she lives in a small village in Gardabani District with her only son – George. George is 22 years old; he is an auto master. He repairs cars and gets a service fee for the work. Dariko is busy with her agricultural business. She has two milking cows, produces yougurt and sells it in Tbilisi (the capital of Georgia). She is been selling yougurt for a long time and has her own customers. She sells it for a good price. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Dariko requested a loan for repairing her cattle-shed, because the existing one is very old. In a new cattle-shed Dariko will be able to keep more livestock and take good care of them. This will help her to expand her agricultural business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to repair her cattle-shed

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: El banco comunal corazon de jesus tiene 11 intregrante, Melida, Dorotea, teresita, erlinda, maria, Alejandro, Dominga,Maria, Rosa, Juana, Liduvina, todos tiene actividades economicas diferentes,  Melida es la cordinadora de la asociacion comunal la cual se encarga de la comunicación y resposabildiad del grupo ella tine por actividad economica una pulperia ubica en su casa de habitacion, esta solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de productos de consumo diario como: aceite, azucar, frijoles, arroz, pan, productos lacteos, verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
The Corazón de Jesús communal bank has 11 members, Melida, Dorotea, Teresita, Erlinda, Maria, Alejandro, Domina, Maria, Rosa, Juana, and Liduvina.  All of them have different business activities.

Melida is the coordinator of the communal bank.  She is in charge of the communication, and she is responsible for the group.  She has a grocery store located in her house.  She is requesting the loan to buy basic consumable products like cooking oil, sugar, beans, rice, bread, dairy products, and vegetables, among others.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, beans, rice, bread, dairy products, and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años y se dedica a la venta de calzados en las ferias donde también vende ropa de segunda mano. Ella se siente agradecida con FINCA Perú porque con todo lo que le enseñaron su negocio ha aumentado y eso ayudo en su casa para los alimentos diarios, le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal ya que dice son buenos por que aprende mucho ya sea en lo personal y en el negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como zapatos para damas y caballeros, zapatillas para niños.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Azucenas communal bank.  She is 36 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years.  She sells footwear at the fairs where they also sell second hand clothes.

She is grateful to FINCA Perú because with everything that they taught her, her business has increased.  This helps with the daily bread for her household.

She likes the trainings that she gets in her communal bank.  She says they are good because she learns a lot, whether it is personal or for the business.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy shoes for women and men, and she will buy sneakers for children.

loans.use: to buy shoes for women and men and sneakers for children.

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder obtener los recursos necesarios y realizar una nueva compra en variedad de ropa como blusas, ropa interior y ropa para niños, también se comprará una buena parte de harinilla para cerdos, ya que continúa con su granja, con la que está pendiente siempre de tener el alimento necesario, hoy dia atiende dos ocupaciones la venta de ropa y la crianza de cerdos.

Ella manifiesta que el crédito anterior le permitío mantener un equilibrio económico entre el negocio y su familia, le ha dado la menor solvencia para hacerle frente a las obligaciones.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan so that she can obtain the resources she needs and make a new purchase of a variety of clothing, such as blouses, underwear and children's clothing.  She will also buy a large amount of pig feed, because she is continuing to work on her farm, and she is aware of the need to always have the animal feed that she needs on hand.  At this time, she has two jobs: selling clothing, and raising pigs.

She states that her previous loan allowed her to maintain a financial equilibrium between her business and her family.  It has provided her with some financial resources so that she can deal with her obligations.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear and children's clothing, and also to buy pig feed

loans.name: Qizlarkhon

texts.en:
Qizlarkhon is a very clever young woman. She is a perfect business lady. Her experiences  help her to develop business and to be the best between other business women. 

Qizlarkhon has own business more than five years. She is busy with gardening. There are many fruit trees in the garden. She sells fruits in the local market. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents love Qizlarkhon very much and proud of her. She wants to repair her house but her income doesn't not enough. She is asking a loan to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her family's house.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es:
Susy tiene 29 años, vive en compañía de su pequeño hijo y sus padres en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chilca, donde vivió desde muy niña.  
Ella es una mujer muy independiente y sale adelante para el futuro de los suyos. Trabaja en una empresa consultora, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Más su actividad paralela es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, a la que se dedica desde hace muchos años, por ello tiene muchos clientes, quienes cada mes comprar los productos que oferta. Como es una mujer muy inteligente, siempre ofrece descuentos, pues de esa manera obtiene más clientes, quienes compran más productos. Asimismo, también vende lencería y ropa por catálogo. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos y poder comprar más productos de menor precio, para que en campañas siguientes pueda ofrecer los descuentos.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su crédito número 16 con MFP, por tanto espera de este préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Susy invertirá este dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de belleza para vender a sus clientes. 	¿Qué es lo que comprará con este dinero?
texts.en:
Susy is 29 years old and lives with her parents and small son in her own house in the locality of Chilca, where she has lived since early childhood.  

Susy is a very independent woman and she is forging ahead for the future of her family. She works in a consultancy where she earns good money. But her parallel activity is selling beauty products by catalog, as she has done for many years. Susy has many clients who each month, buy the products she offers. As a very intelligent woman, she always offers discounts and in this way, obtains more customers who buy more products. In addition, Susy also sells linens and clothing by catalog. Now she wishes to improve her income by buying more products at a lower price, so that she can offer discounts in future campaigns. 

Susy belongs to “The Entrepreneurs” solidarity group; this is her 16th loan through MFP, and she hopes with this loan to achieve her objectives. Moreover, Susy promises to comply with her schedule of payments, as she has in previous loans. Susy is grateful to be part of her association because all the members are responsible and supportive persons.

And what will she buy with this money? Susy will invest the loan in purchasing beauty products to sell to her clients.

loans.use: buy more beauty products to augment her stock.

loans.name: Hamadh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hamadh and consists of three women (Fakhriah, Riadh and Jwhra) and two men (both named Mohammed). 

Fakhriah is 45 years old, married woman and comes from Taiz, Yemen. She is the woman who stands beside a man in the photo. She has a house. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs. She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs for her house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Rubí y tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 10 años y tiene una tienda donde se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para vehículos. En todo el tiempo que pertenece a la institución ella aprendió a ahorrar y eso le transmitió a todos sus hijos, ahora se siente satisfecha por todo lo que a logrado, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal donde dice es puntual y responsable gracias a las capacitaciones que allí recibe, considera que son muy importantes para su negocio y su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de lubricantes para vehículos como aceite de motor, hidrolina entre otros.
texts.en:
Teresa’s a member of the “Rubí” (Ruby) communal bank.  She’s 54-years-old, a widow and mother of five children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for more than ten years.  She has a store where she sells vehicle lubricants. 

In the time she’s been a member of the institution she learned to save and taught all her children to do so too.  Now, she feels satisfied for all she’s accomplished.  She enjoys attending meetings of her communal bank and she says that she’s punctual and responsible thanks to the training she gets there that she thinks is very important both for her business and for her family.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy lubricants for vehicle motors like ‘hidrolina,’ among others.

loans.use: to buy vehicle lubricants.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 35 years old. She lives in the small village of Sagarejo with her family -- her husband, Aleksander, and two children (12 and 16 years old). Both of them go to the local school. Aleksander works in the State Department and Nino works as a teacher in the village kindergarten. Along with above-mentioned activities, they are busy with the agricultural business. In particular, they are busy with livestock. They have two milking cows and three calves. They produce cheese, which is sold locally and to the cheese merchant at the local open market. They work hard, but they still don’t have enough income to purchase additional household goods or renovate their house.

Nino requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Therefore, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With the increased income Nino and Aleksander will be able to finish repairing their house. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesitan de capital para continuar en su trabajo en la agricultura, pues está realizando la siembra de maíz y frijol para esto necesita comprarse el abono y los herbicidas necesarias para prevenir las plagas, con la ayuda de este préstamo el logrará nuevamente realizar el proceso agrícola de la mejor manera con el fin de obtener al final una cosecha sana y abundante.

Con el préstamo anterior José considera haber recibido la ayuda para poder realizar su cultivo de maíz y frijol esto le permitió también ayudar a su familia con los gastos económicos a través de las ganancias que obtuvo por la venta de cosecha, hasta el momento todas sus condiciones se mantienen estables.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he needs capital to continue with his work in agriculture because he’s planting corn and beans and needs to buy manure and herbicide to prevent infestations with.  With help from this loan he will once again be able to carry out his agricultural process in the best way in order to obtain in the end a healthy, abundant harvest.

José believes that with his previous loan he produced his corn and bean crops which allowed him also to use his profits he obtained from the harvest to help his family with their expenses.  To date, all his conditions remain stable.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa sigue con su comercio de venta de productos plásticos y su pequeña pulperia, ella es quien elabora,los productos plasticos, teniendo las maquinas para su realización, con más de veinte años de experiencia, la mayoría de su productos como vasos, platos, pana pequeña y grandes de plástico son entregadas al por mayor, en estos últimos años ha elaborado mas,  al obtener financiamiento.
Con este nuevo préstamo  invertirá en la compra de plástico de reciclaje, colorante, correa de máquina, yarda de tela para resistencia, yarda de alambre de resistencia, para elaborar cinco mil pocillos pequeños, tres mil pocillos grandes, dos mil tina, un mil taza cafetera, entre otros. Satisfaciendo a sus clientes y obteniendo sus ganancias para sus gastos del hogar, siempre apoyándose con su esposo, ambos trabajando juntos.
texts.en:
Rosa continues selling plastic items and with her small grocery store.  She makes the plastic items.  She has the machines necessary to do so and has more than 20 years’ experience.  Most of her products consist of glasses, dishes, small and large plastic baskets that she sells at wholesale.  In the last few years she’s manufactured more thanks to getting financing.

She will use this new loan to buy recycled plastic, dyes, motor belts, yards of resistance fabric, yards of resistance wire to manufacture five-thousand small mugs, three-thousand large mugs, two-thousand tubs, one-thousand coffee cups, among others to meet customer demand and obtain profits for her household’s expenses.  She always has support from her husband; they both work together.

loans.use: to buy recycled plastic and other supplies.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 30 años es una responsable madre soltera. Vive en la localidad de Tapo junto a su hija Jesenia, en una pequeña casa que heredó de su madre hace 8 años.  
Su madre también le dio cinco hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papa y alverja. Sus terrenos se sitúan en una zona muy lejana, tiene que caminar muchas horas para llegar a cuidar de sus sembríos. En tiempos de cosecha contrata peones, para que trabajen la tierra junto con ella. Cuenta que es muy rentable su actividad, pues ella misma traslada sus productos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad. “Hay fechas en las que tengo que comprar otras cosechas para poder abastecer a mis clientes”, afirma. Por ello, su objetivo es convertirse en distribuidora y poder tener mayores ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa Rosa” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Está segura de concretar sus planes, con este apoyo financiero. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Martha invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de otras producciones de alverja y todo tipo de verduras para venderlas en el mercado mayorista.
texts.en:
Martha, 30, is a responsible single mother.  She lives in Tapo with her daughter, Jesenia, in a small house she inherited from her mother 8 years ago.

Her mother also gave her five hectares of farmland where she grows corn, potatoes and peas.  Her fields are located very far away and she must walk several hours to reach them.  During the harvest season she hires day laborers to help her work the land.

She comments that her activity is quite profitable because she transports the goods to the city’s wholesale market herself.  “There are times when I must buy other crops in order to be able to supply my customers,” she affirms.  Because of this, her goal is to become a distributor to earn higher profits.

She belongs to the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan.  She is sure that she’ll reach her goals with this financial support.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments.

Martha will use the money requested to buy other pea crops and all types of vegetables to then sell them in the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy peas and vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 23 años. Vive en compañía de su madre, Bernardina, y su hermano, Rubén, en la casa de ella, ubicada en el caserío de Tapo.  
A pesar de su corta edad trabajó con ahínco para tener lo que ahora posee; cinco parcelas medianas, además de una moto y un televisor. Sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura; con la siembra de papa y maíz, y la elaboración de leña, que es donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Vende un promedio de 20 millares en 15 días, esta cantidad varía, ya que depende de la temporada que demore secar la leña. “En esta temporada de verano puedo tener mayor producción, también importa el grosor de los árboles”, menciona. Además, desea estudiar, aunque no tenga las posibilidades, pues vive muy alejado de la ciudad. Pero planea, con el tiempo, ahorrar lo necesario para lograr su objetivo.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa Rosa” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Está seguro de concretar sus planes, con este apoyo financiero. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito. Y le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Víctor invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 40 árboles para elaborar leña, pues en este mes de verano tiene mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Víctor, 23, lives in the company of his mother, Bernardina, and his brother, Rubén, in his mother’s house located in Tapo.

Despite his young age he worked very diligently in order to have what he now owns: five medium parcels of land as well as a motorcycle and a television set.  

His main economic activities are agriculture, corn and potatoes, and he also makes firewood which is where he earns his highest profits.  He sells on average 20-thousands in 15 days.  This amount varies because it depends on the time it takes him to produce the firewood.  “In the summer season I can produce more; the thickness of the trees is also an important factor,” he mentions.  He’d also like to study even not having the possibility of doing so because he lives very far from the city but he plans in time to save enough to reach his objective.

He belongs to the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is his second MFP loan.  He’s sure to reach his goals with this financial help.  On the other hand he promises to make his installment payments just like he did with his previous loan.  He enjoys being part of his group because all the members are responsible, very supportive people.

Víctor will use the money from this loan to buy 40 trees to make firewood because demand is higher in the summer.

loans.use: to buy 40 trees to convert into firewood.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en negocio mejorando su trabajo hacia los clientes, en esta ocasión se comprará una tijera especial para cortar aluminio, ya que es muy necesaria en la ejecución de sus labores, ayudándole a realizar sus actividades.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue mejorar la atención a los clientes, realizó una buena inversión en su negocio adquiriendo materiales, esto le ha permitido crecer y mantener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to continue investing in his business improving his work toward his customers.  On this occasion he wants to buy a special shear to cut aluminum since it’s very necessary for his work since it will help him to do his activities.

His previous loan’s effect was better customer service.  He made a good investment acquiring materials for his business which allowed him to grow and earn the necessary income to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy shears to cut aluminum.

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.es: Nancy vive en el sector conocido como Isla Trinitaria, tiene 46 años y se encuentra casada con Fidel quien se dedica a la gasfitería. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Nancy empezó su negocio pro iniciativa de una amiga quien le indico que le iba bien y que probara para así tener ingresos extras. Como es ama de casa no tuvo ningún inconveniente en empezar su negocio, visita a sus familiares, amigos y clientes a sus domicilio o trabajo ofertando sus productos por catalogo. Poco a poco se dio cuenta que la venta dejaba buenas ganancias por lo que continuo y empezó a buscar más clientes por su barrio.  Los productos que oferta son perfumes a $ 35.00 cremas a $ 23.00 bisutería a $ 55.00 teniendo un margen de utilidad del 34%. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos que se encuentran en promoción para aumentar su inventario por lo cual al venderlos tendría una rentabilidad más alta. Su meta futura es adecuar su casa ya que necesita de varios arreglos.
texts.en:
Nancy lives in a sector known as Isla Trinitaria.  She’s 46-years-old, married to Fidel who is a plumber.  Her children are all adults and are independent.

Nancy started her business encouraged by a girlfriend who told her she was doing well and she should try it herself as a way of earning extra income.  
Since she’s a housewife she saw no problem with starting her business.  She visits her family members, friends and customers in their homes or at their work offering products via catalogue.  She gradually became aware that the sales were producing good profits so she continued with it and started to seek out more customers in her neighborhood.

She sells perfume for $35.00, creams for $23.00 and costume jewelry for $55.00 obtaining a 34% profit margin.  She will use the loan to buy products that are on special promotion to increase her inventory so that when she sells them she will earn an even higher profit.  Her future goal is to do some home improvements since it needs several repairs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la variedad de mariscos en su negocio, con estos fondos prestados logrará comprarse pescado fresco, camarones y otras especies en mariscos que son de la preferencia de los clientes, esto le dará a María una mejor apariencia en el negocio manteniéndolo surtido.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, realizando una buena inversión en el negocio que hasta el momento le ha permitido estabilizar sus ventas, su familia y sus condiciones son estables, sus ingresos han logrado cubrir parte de las necesidades que atraviesa su hogar.
texts.en:
María’s asking for a new loan to invest in a variety of seafood for her business.  With this borrowed money she will be able to buy fresh fish, shrimp and other species of seafood her customers prefer which will make María’s business more attractive by having it well-stocked.

Her previous loan had a positive effect.  She made a good investment in her business and to date her sales have remained stable.  Her family and living conditions are stable too.  She’s been able to cover part of her household’s expenses with her income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
Cosme tiene 46 años, su esposa es Rosa y tienen tres hijos. Viven en la casa que alquiló hace dos años en la localidad de Batanyacu. 
Desde hace 15 años comenzó en el oficio del pintado y planchado de carros. “Tengo clientes fijos quienes ya me conocen y contratan mi servicio”, afirma. Su taller se ubica en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, en un parque automotor, donde alquila el espacio a una señora que vive en el lugar. Su trabajo lo realiza solo, pues no requiere de mucha ayuda, ya que conoce su trabajo y es muy hábil en lo que desarrolla. “Existen domingos, días en los que descanso, que aun tengo que trabajar para culminar mi trabajo”, menciona con mucho orgullo, pues gracias a su trabajo pudo cuidar a su familia. Ahora su proyecto es obtener las máquinas que le servirán para aminorar el tiempo que le demora pintar los carros y así obtener más trabajos y mejores ganancias. Con lo que piensa ahorrar quiere comprar su casa propia. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo, al que acaba de ingresar.
Cosme invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de una máquina comprensora que le facilitará el pintado de carros con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Cosme, 46, and his wife, Rosa, have three children.  They live in a house he rented two years ago in Batanyacu.

Fifteen years ago he started his occupation painting and detailing cars. “I have regular customers who already know me and contract my services,” he affirms.   His workshop is in a centrally-located spot in the city in an auto park zone; he rents the space from a woman who lives there.

He does his work alone because he doesn’t require much help since he knows his work and he’s very skillful in what he does.  “There are Sundays, my day off, when even then I have to work in order to complete my jobs,” he mentions proudly because thanks to his work he’s able to care for his family.

Now his project is to acquire more machines that will help him shorten the time it takes to paint cars thus enabling him to take on more jobs and earn better profits that he plans to use to buy a house.

This is his first MFP loan and he is very grateful for the financial support he gets because he’ll be able to reach his business goals.  He also promises to be punctual with his installment payments since he learns much from the other members of the group he’s just joined.

Cosme will use the money from this loan to buy an air compressor that will make painting the cars easier.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Lenis

texts.es: Lenis de 39 años vive con su cónyuge y sus  2os hijos en las edades de 18 y 22 años en Malambo, municipio localizado  en la ribera oriental del río Magdalena y es uno de los cinco que conforman el área metropolitana de Barranquilla, ciudad que se encuentra a 20 minutos. Su negocio consiste en vender mediante catálogos, mercancías variadas como suéteres masculinos, ropa para dama, cosméticos, artículos de aseo personal, mediante el sistema de crédito, que ofrece a una clientela, que poco a poco ha construido y la siente como suya. Su negocio representa la fuente principal de ingresos de su familia desde hace 19 años, cuando decidió emprenderlo, buscando oportunidades de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lenis vende de todo un poco, porque está vinculada a 6 revistas comerciales y sabe comprar, para que sus clientes estén bien satisfechos. Por eso prefiere los productos que llegan con descuentos y los mantiene en inventarios, con los que sorprende a sus compradores por los precios que ella les otorga. Su meta es ampliar su negocio ensanchando su mercado, adicionarle vitrinas, que permitan una exhibición impactante a la vista de sus potenciales compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará ropa femenina, ropa masculina, champoo, suéteres, colonias y una vitrina. Su credikiva resultará ser muy exitoso, por la experiencia en inversiones que tiene Lenis en productos, con los que su clientela se siente siempre feliz de comprarle y regresa a hacerle pedidos.
texts.en:
Lenis, 39, lives with her spouse and two children who are 18 and 22 years of age in Malambo, a town located along the east bank of the Magdalena River and is one of the five that form the Barranquilla Metropolitan Area, a city located 20 minutes away.

Her business consists of catalogue sales.  She sells varied merchandise like men’s sweaters, women’s clothes, cosmetics, personal hygiene products.  She sells on credit to her clientele that she’s gradually been building up and considers her own.  

Her business has been her family’s main source of income since she started it 19 years ago seeking opportunities to move her children forward.  Lenis sells a little bit of everything because she’s linked to six commercial catalogues and knows how to buy to satisfy her customers.  This is why she prefers products that have discounts attached and she keeps them in her inventory to surprise her buyers with the prices she quotes.

Her goal is to expand the business enlarging her customer base adding display cases that will allow her to display her wares in an eye-catching way for her potential buyers.  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy women’s clothes, men’s clothes, shampoo, sweaters, colognes and a display case.  FMSD believes that her Kiva loan will be very successful because of Lenis’ experience with product purchases designed to always keep her customers happy to buy from her and returning to place orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shampoo, cologne and a display case.

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Ilva, sigue con su negocio de pulpería y venta de útiles escolares, negocio que ha venido invirtiendo en inventario atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic, que han sido de gran satisfacción en su hogar, su esposo labora como conductor y sus hijas cursan el año escolar.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo Ilva, invertirá en granos básicos, en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidón de aceite, bolsón de papel higiénico, cereales, pote de leche, golosinas, productos coca cola, carne, pollo, huevo entre otros como utiles ecolares. Para seguir ofertando a sus cliente variedad de productos. Como planes con sus ganancias es poner cerámica en su sala ya que aun es de tierra y desea hacer esta mejora para el bienestar  familiar.
texts.en:
Ilva continues working in her grocery store business and selling school supplies.  She has been investing in stock through loans from Afodenic.  This has been of great use to her household.  Ilva's husband works as a driver and her children are in school.

Ilva will invest this new loan in buying basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, toilet paper, cereals, milk, candies, Coca Cola products, chicken, eggs and school supplies so that she can offer her customers a wide range of products.

Ilva plans to use her profits to lay some tiles in her living room as it is currently bare earth.  She would like to make this improvement for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cereals and other goods in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Anuar Jesus

texts.es: Anuar de 40 años de edad tiene un taller de metalmecánica en Malambo; municipio localizado  en la ribera oriental del río Magdalena y es uno de los cinco que conforman el área metropolitana de Barranquilla, ciudad que se encuentra a 20 minutos. Su experiencia data desde hace 20 años, cuando se desempeñó como soldador en un local ubicado en una vía preferencial de la ciudad y paralelo a esto, laboró en varias empresas durante 5 años. Poco a poco fue ahorrando, hasta lograr ser independiente, pues adquirió sus propias herramientas, con las cuales emprendió su negocio. Desde hace 7 años tiene su taller en su propia casa y fabrica puertas, ventanas, rejas, y también trabaja en latonería y pintura automotriz. Actualmente sus planes de crecimiento lo hacen sentir con poco capital de trabajo, para lograr expandir su negocio, pues espera incrementar su clientela, adecuar en un futuro su vivienda y él sabe  que esto es poco a poco. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas parta elaborar puertas y rejas, que tiene encargadas, así como para empezar a realizar las adecuaciones en su vivienda, que le permitan estar mas confortable con su familia, la cual está conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 8, 10 y 13 años, a quienes espera verlos convertidos en personas exitosas en su futuro y para quienes trabaja.
texts.en: 40-year-old Anuar has a metal shop in Malambo, a town on the east bank of the river Magdalena.  It is one of the five towns that make up the metropolitan area of Barranquilla.  The city of Barranquilla is 20 minutes away.  Anuar has 20 years experience.  He used to work as a welder in a shop which was located on a main road in the city.  In parallel with this, he also worked for a number of different companies for five years.  He gradually saved up enough to start working for himself.  He acquired his own tools and started his own business.  He has been running his workshop in his home for seven years, making doors, windows and grilles.  He also works as a panel beater and car painter.  He would like to grow and expand his business as he would like to increase his number of customers and carry out work on his house.  However, he doesn't have enough working capital and knows that he must achieve these things gradually.  He is applying for a Kiva loan (his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy raw materials for making doors and grilles which he has orders for.  He will also start making some improvements to his home which will allow him and his family to live more comfortably.  His family consists of his wife and their three children who are 8, 10 and 13 years old.  He hopes to see his children become successful people in the future and so he works hard for them.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making doors and grilles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on beverages and drinks.

loans.name: Fashagakura Group

texts.fr:
Angele fait partie du  Fashagakura  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée à Régis, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants dont  1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce du riz, du haricot, de l'huile de palme depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité du riz, du haricot, de l'huile de palme,… à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait, améliorer la vie de ses enfants et  leur payer  les frais de scolarité.
texts.en: Angele is a part of the Fashagakura group and lives in Gitega. She is 30 years old and is married to Régis, a farmer. Together, they have 4 children, one of whom attends school. She has been selling rice, beans, and palm oil for 8 years. She is on her eleventh Turame loan. With her KIVA loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, and palm oil to resell to earn more. In the coming years, she would like to improve her children's lives and pay for their schooling.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a large quantity of rice, beans, palm oil to resell and earn more

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: Ana compró muchas cosas con su credikiva: zapatos, bolsos, ropa exterior y logró dar respuesta a la demanda de sus clientes. Ahora se propone lograr impactar a nueva clientela y requiere un poco mas de capital de trabajo y por eso acude una vez mas a su credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado de buenas marcas que tiene encargados y los cuales le dejan una importante rentabilidad. “Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Estoy muy por la ayuda prestada ya que podido salir adelante con mi negocio.”
texts.en: Ana bought many things with her previous Kiva loan - shoes, bags and outerwear - and was able to respond to her customer demand.  She now plans to impress new customers and needs a little more working capital.  For this reason, she is applying for another Kiva loan.  She will use her money to buy good brands of shoes that she has orders for and which make her good profits.  Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: "I am very grateful for the help you have given me as I have been able to make progress in my business".

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 47 years old. She lives in a small village in Gardabani District with her family: her husband, Loseb, and a 20-year-old son. The family members are busy with agricultural business. They have four milking cows and six calves. Zeinab milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese. Part of the dairy food is used by the family and the rest is sold on the local open market. Along with agricultural business, Zeinab is also busy with teaching. She is a teacher in the local school and gets a salary. 

Zeinab requested a loan for repairing and expanding the cattle shed because the existing one is very old. She plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the building is expanded and repaired, Zeinab will purchase calves and raise them. After a year she will be able to double production and sales of cheese, and the income of the family will significantly increase. As a result of the above-mentioned, all members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the cattle shed

loans.name: Charlotte's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Charlotte, la responsable, âgée de 54 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a une baraque où elle vend des canaris, des paniers et des volailles depuis quelques années. Charlotte fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Dans le but d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt et de participer aux charges de la famille. Charlotte se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two people with a single loan. Charlotte, the leader, is 54 years old, and is a married mother of four. She has a shack where she has been selling pottery containers, baskets, and fowl for several years. Charlotte stocks up in one of the markets in the sub-region. In the goal of growing her business and satisfying the needs of her customers, she has turned to Finadev's microloan. This loan will allow her to maximize her interest and help with the family expenses. Charlotte is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 48 pottery containers and 34 baskets

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 42 years old. She lives in Gardabani District with her family: a 17-year-old son, Beka, and her brother and mother. Beka is an agricultural worker; he helps neighbor farmers in agricultural works and gets a service fee for the work. Her mother is a pensioner. Her brother has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Leila is busy with agricultural activities. She has four milking cows and produces cheese. Leila and her mother sell milk and produced cheese in Tbilisi (the capital of Georgia). The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari. They work hard but their income is hardly enough for food for and everyday expenses of all four members of the family. They still don’t have enough income to make some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or for renovation of the house.

Leila requested a loan for purchasing feed for the livestock and to repair the cattle shed because the existing one is very old and uncomfortable. She will feed her livestock well and will take good care of them in the new cattle shed. She hopes that it will increase milking and production of the cheese accordingly. Thus, Leila will get additional income. With increased income she will be able to repair the house for her son and leave something worthwhile for him for the future. Leila hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle and repair the roof of the cattle shed

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Madame Akou est revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales depuis 2010. Elle exerce cette activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé.  Elle est mariée à un électricien et ils eurent ensemble 02 enfants (13 et 09ans) tous scolarisés.  Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’acheter des marchandises afin d’assurer le bonheur des clients. Elle veut élargir l’étalage et voir ses enfants réussir.
texts.en: Mrs. Akou has been a seller of general food products since 2010. She sells her goods in a shop and generally stocks up in Lomé. She is married to an electrician, and they have 2 children together (13 and 9 years old), both of whom attend school. She is seeking this first loan to buy goods in order to ensure the happiness of her customers. She would like to grow her display and to see her children succeed.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée à un déclarant en douanes, Madame Afi est âgée de 36ans, mère de 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Elle est couturière de profession et en même temps vend des pagnes et des sacs dames depuis 1998. Elle exerce seule l’activité et est à son troisiéme crédit de WAGES. Ce montant qu’elle demande l’aidera à s’approvisionner en pagnes et sacs dames à Lomé. Avec le profit réalisé, elle espère réaménager son atelier. Dans l’avenir madame Afi voudrait ajouter la vente de bazins et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Married to a customs officer, Mrs. Afi is a 36-year-old mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She is a seamstress and has also been selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and ladies' purses since 1998. She does this by herself and is on her third WAGES loan. This amount that she is asking for will help her stock up on pagnes and purses in Lomé. With the profit, she hopes to rearrange her workshop. In the future, Mrs. Afi would like to add the sale of bazins (traditional articles of clothing) and to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) and ladies' purses

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 39 years old. She lives in a small village of Martkopi District with her family: her parents-in-law, who are pensioners, a sister-in-law, and an 18-year-old son, George. Her sister-in-law has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Nino runs an agricultural business. She has a milking cow and produces cheese and sells it in nearby villages. In addition to her agricultural work, she is busy with trading. She buys secondhand clothes in Tbilisi (the capital of Georgia) and sells them in her village. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Nino requested a loan for purchasing calves. She plans to grow them and sell them after several months with a price markup. With the increased income Nino will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Mavile

texts.en:
Mavile is 51 years old. She lives in the Keda District of West Georgia with her family: her husband (Zebur), 29-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter. Zebur works at the State Department, and their son works as a security officer at the Bank of Georgia. Both of them get a monthly salary. Mavile is busy with her agricultural business. She owns 0.2 hectares of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown (cabbage, potato, tomato, cucumber, orange, and lemon). She sells the harvested products at the local open market. She also has a cow and sells the milk in nearby villages.

Mavlie has requested a loan to open a grocery store in a building located in the Keda District. She will purchase the refrigerators and grocery products. According to her estimates, the store will be profitable, as there are no similar stores nearby in her district. She will offer her customers a big assortment of products. Thus, the income of her family will increase. With the increased profit, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Mavlie hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To open a grocery store and purchase items for the store

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Mr Kossivi est âgé de 25ans et sa conjointe est revendeuse.  Il est vitrier et ce travail consiste à fabriquer des miroirs, des phares de voitures et des cadres photos. Il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des matériels de travail à Lomé. Il veut dans l’avenir réinvestir dans l’activité, ouvrir un atelier annexe et assurer la santé de la famille. Une personne l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité.
texts.en:
Mr Kossivi is 25 years old and his wife is a retailer. He is a glazier; his work involves making mirrors, car headlights and photo frames. 

He is asking for a first loan from WAGES to buy materials in  Lomé. In the future, he wants to reinvest in his business, open another workshop and meet the healthcare needs of his family. He has one assistant to help him in his work.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Akesso

texts.fr: Aidé par 01 personne dans l’exercice de son activité de fabrication de chaussures, Mr Akesso a ouvert depuis 2011 un atelier. Il est âgé de 31ans et n’a pas encore de personnes en charge. Il effectue des opérations financières avec WAGES il y a un temps et sollicite un prêt chez nous pour acheter des matières premières pour la fabrication des chaussures. Il veut avoir un grand atelier de fabrication de chaussures et après se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Helped by one person in the business of making shoes, Mr. Akesso opened a workshop in 2011. He is 31 years old and doesn't yet have any one in his care. He has been carrying out his financial operations with WAGES for a while and is seeking a loan to buy raw materials with which to make shoes. He wants to have a big shoe-making workshop and get married afterwards.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Maria de 28 años tiene un restaurant de su propiedad ubicado en las Orquídeas, sector norte de Guayaquil. Su esposo Manuel es chofer profesional y brinda el servicio de taxi amigo en el sector, juntos tienen 2 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal. Maria empezó con el negocio porque el trabajo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos personales, por lo que decidió alquilar un local en mucho lote, de esto han pasado un año y tiene varios clientes fijos. De momento no tiene ayudante por lo que la preparación y atención la realiza ella, abre solo medio día desde las 7:30 con los desayunos hasta las 3:00 de la tarde que vende los almuerzos. El préstamo lo empleara para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos. Maria espera seguir con el negocio para poder contratar a 2 personas para que le ayuden en su atención y así poder distribuir mejor su tiempo para pasarlo con sus hijos.
texts.en: Twenty eight year old Maria runs her own restaurant in Orquídeas, in northern Guayaquil. Her husband, Manuel, is a taxi driver who offers a private, on-call service in the local area; they have 2 children together who are at public school. Maria started the business because her husband's work did not cover the family expenses, so she decided to hire a unit on a large plot of land. It has been a year since then and she has many regular customers. At the moment, she doesn't have any help so she does all the preparation and serving herself. She opens for a half day from 7:30am for breakfasts until 3:00pm for lunches. She will use this loan to buy produce for preparing meals. Maria hopes to continue with her business so that she will be able to hire 2 people to help her with serving the customers, and then she will be able to divide her time better in order to spend some of it with her children.

loans.use: to buy rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Alexandra vive en Libertad, su casa es de caña pero cuenta con los servicios básicos, a sus 32 años se dedica a la venta de maduros con queso, choclos asados y carne en palito. En un principio el negocio era de su mamá, al fallecer ella tomo su lugar para continuar brindando el servicio a sus clientes. Le gusta mucho la preparación de comida por lo que vende desde desayunos, almuerzos, jugos y colas. Su negocio le deja el dinero suficiente para cubrir sus gastos pero también se ayuda con la venta de artesanías. Alexandra cuenta que su mayor preocupación son las enfermedades sobre todo la diabetes la cual fue causante de la muerte de su mamá, desde entonces cuida su salud siguiendo una dieta de prevención. Tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian y e ayudan en el negocio, el préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de productos para la preparación de las comidas, le gustaría que su negocio aumente de tal manera que en un futuro no lejano pueda mejorar el local y su casa.
texts.en:
Alexandra lives in Libertad.  Her house is made from cane but she receives basic services.  She is 32 years old and her business is selling 'maduros con queso' (sweet, ripe plantains with cheese), roasted corn on the cob and 'carne en palito' (thin, seasoned pieces of meat grilled on skewers).  The business used to belong to her mom but, when she died, Alexandra took over so that she could continue providing a service to their customers.  She really enjoys preparing food and she sells breakfasts, lunches, juices and colas.  Her business makes her enough money to cover her expenses but she also helps herself by selling handicrafts.

Alexandra says that her biggest worry is illness, especially diabetes which is what killed her mom.  Since her mom died she has taken care of her health, following a preventive diet.  She has two children who are in school and who help her in her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for preparing food.  She would like to grow her business so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can improve her premises and her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 54 years old. She lives in a small village of Khelvachauri District with her big family: her husband, David, four children (27, 29, 31 and 32 years old), two daughters-in-law, and three grandchildren. 

The family members earn their living through an agricultural business. They have 0.5 hectare of land, where they grow vegetables and fruits. They also have a citrus garden and sell mandarins on the local open market. The family has beehives with bee colonies. They produce honey and sell it in nearby villages. 

David also has a truck. He takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. They work hard, but their income is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses for eleven members of the family.

Natela requested a loan to repair the truck because it is damaged and is already risky to drive in the forest. For this reason, David has stopped operations. After repairing the truck, David will be able to continue transportation and sales of wood. This will increase the sales. Increased income will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the truck so her husband can continue transportation and sales of wood.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 44 years old. She lives in a small village in Khelvachauri District with her family: her three children (the elder children are students and the younger goes to the local school) and her husband, Tengiz. Nargiz and Tengiz are busy with agricultural business. They have two cows and produce cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. They own 0.5 hectare of land, where they grow various vegetables and fruits. Nargiz and Tengiz are especially busy with the plot during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They sell the harvested product on the local open market. 

Nargiz requested a loan to expand her agricultural business. She will purchase materials to build a greenhouse. In the greenhouse she will grow various vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, and greens) through the entire year. This will increase the sales and monthly income of the family. With the increased income Nargiz and Tengiz will repair the house. As a result of the above-mentioned, living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is widowed with five children and none of her children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people, but on retail.  

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in this business for ten years and works seven days a week.  Besides this clothing business, she also generates additional income through tailoring. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she gets enough profits to buy a plot of land and build her own house, and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina tiene 55 años, vive en el sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive sus hijos y su esposo quien es comerciante y la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos. Ella tiene su negocio desde hace 20 años.
Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades ya que esta en calle principal de la carreta hacia Cedeño, y esto hace que su negocio sea muy visitado.
Doña Marina el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, carnés, embutidos, huevos, azúcar, refresco, arroz, lácteos, pollo, mariscos etc. el impacto esperado en el crédito, es comprar una variedad de productos, para así de esta manera brindarles una variedad de platillos, a cada uno de sus clientes los cuales visitan su negocio, ya que por la calidad de sus productos tiene mucha demanda.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Marina es hacer crecer su negocio, y ser una de los mejores en su comunidad de igual manera obtener mejores ingresos, para tener una mejor calidad de vida, para ella y su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras – Junio del 2012.
texts.en:
Marina, 55, lives in south Honduras.  Her children and her husband, who is merchant and helps support her and backs her up in all her obligations, live with her.  She’d had a business for 20 years.  It’s located in a strategic spot where there many passers-by since it’s on the main road on the way to Cedeño which makes her business very visited.

Marina needs the loan to buy corn, meat, cured meats, eggs, sugar, soft-drinks, rice, dairy products, chicken, seafood, etc.  She hopes the loan will have an impact in the purchase of a variety of products so that she can provide a variety of dishes to each of the customers that visits her business since the quality of her products has led to high demand.

Marina’s future plans are to make her business grow and to be one of the best in her community as well as to earn better income to have a better quality of life for her and her family.

Choluteca, Honduras-June, 2012

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS VECINOS  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Maisa  tiene 24 años, ella es soltera,  La Sra. Maisa tiene la actividad de transporte de pasajeros en la localidad de el Torno ella es moto taxista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maisa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para su motocicleta  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Maisa va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando repuestos y si se puede otra motocicleta, la Sra. Maisa  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The 'Los Vecinos' (Neighbors) community bank has nine members: seven women and two men.  The bank's president is 24-year-old Maisa who is single.  Maisa's business is providing a passenger transport service in the town of el Torno.  She is a motorcycle taxi driver.  This loan is her first from the institution.  She will use the loan to buy accessories and spare parts for her motorcycle so that she can provide a better service to her customers and increase her profits.  She is requesting this loan so that she can continue improving in her business.  She will use her profits to continue buying spare parts and, if she is able, another motorcycle.  Maisa is a very hard-working person.  She feels happy with the opportunity that she and her fellow group members are being given as some of them support their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy accessories and spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is married with one child and her child doesn’t go to school. She takes care of additional family members (sisters). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She sells to all categories of people and sells both on retail and wholesale. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she generates additional income through poultry farming. She works from home and also works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of charcoal. She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and rent

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two water tanks @ Le 2,500,000 for his pure water business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 42 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos menores en la casa donde ella renta por más de 12 años ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 8 años al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Doña Martha esta solicitando el préstamo ya por tercera vez  por que quiere comprarse una maquina para elaborar tortillas ya que esta cansada de tanto hacer tortillas de manera artesanal, es por tal razón que necesita el préstamo para salir adelante con su taller y descansar un poco con la ayuda de esta maquina y por ende la productividad será mayor y sus ganancias igual ya que desea atender mas clientes para tener mayores utilidades.
El sueño de Doña Martha es seguir mejorando y tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Martha, 42, lives with her three minor children in a house she’s rented for more than 12 years located in the community of San Lorenzo in south Honduras.  She’s been making and selling tortillas for the last 8 years.

Martha is asking for a loan for the third time because she wants to buy a machine to make tortillas because she’s tired of making so many tortillas in an artisanal way.  Because of this she needs a loan to move ahead with her shop and to rest a bit with help from this machine.  Productivity will be higher as well as profits too since she wants to be able to supply more customers to have higher profits.

Her dream is to continue improving and to have a house of her own.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-June, 2012

loans.use: to buy a tortilla making machine.

loans.name: Esperanza 2006 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA 2006” iniciará el decimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Inés es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: albañil, kiosco de salchipapas, venta de ropa, venta de abarrotes, venta de plantines, venta de plásticos, servicio de fotocopiadoras, tienda de barrio, venta de muebles, comerciante de guantes, ayudante de minibús, venta de calzados.

La señora Inés, indica que hace once ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es clienta en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella cuenta que inicio este negocio hace años, mediante la distribución de azúcar, posteriormente estableció un espacio de venta.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, etc.) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza 2006” (Hope 2006) communal bank will start the 15th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 12 members led by a governing board headed by Inés, the President.  The members of the communal bank are in a variety of businesses among which we have: construction worker, ‘salchipapas’ [fried potatoes with fried sausages] stand, clothes sales, grocery sales, seedlings sales, plastics sales, photocopying services, neighborhood store, furniture sales, glove sales, minibus attendant and shoe sales.

Inés indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for 11 cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a client of the institution.  She currently has a grocery store that she started years ago distributing sugar; later on she set up space for her sales.

The loan she’ll take out now is to expand her merchandise.  She will buy sugar, rice, noodles, etc. from suppliers in the city of El Alto that she’ll subsequently resell in street markets in the city of El Alto.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as well as possible since she’s single and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, noodles, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Amadu. He is married and has two children aged 23 and 17 years. In 1990, Amadu established his provisions-and-drinks business. He began his business at an early age with his father but finally took over after the death of his father. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Amadu has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy soft drinks and alcoholic drinks costing SLL 1,500,000 and SLL 3,500,000 to buy an additional freezer for the shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 850,000. In the future, Amadu plans to open a mini supermarket. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and alcoholic drinks costing SLL 1,500,000 and SLL 3,500,000 to buy an additional freezer for the shop.

loans.name: Jineth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jineth de 37 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 3 hijos de 3 a 10 años de edad, que viven en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica a fabricar con sus propias manos, artesanías en foamy, así como desinfectantes y también trabaja la repostería. Desde hace 5 años, empezó su negocio con $200.000 COP, que le regaló su padre, con los cuales compró cubrelechos, toallas, ropa y desde hace 2 años empezó sus trabajos en foamy, después de haber hecho un curso en el que aprendió esta técnica. Muy pronto se dio a conocer por la calidad de sus trabajos de los que le solicitan diversos artículos en diferentes ocasiones, como en fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, y también elabora adornos y suvenires con esta misma técnica que son de mucha aplicabilidad  el interior de las viviendas. Adicionalmente también aprendió a elaborar postres hace 5 meses y agregó a su negocio la fabricación de ellos, especialmente  el de arroz con leche, que distribuye en su propio barrio entre pequeños comerciantes, entre familias cercanas y también en el mercado de clientes que desde hace 5 años conserva y cada vez gana aun mas, por su buena calidad en el servicio. En la actualidad quiere emprender una pequeña miscelánea, donde pueda exhibir las bellas manualidades que elabora y que este se convierta en un punto de encuentro social para su comunidad. Hoy Jineth está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprara insumos y materiales para la producción de sus artesanías en foamy, los que requiere comprar en mayor volumen,  para obtener los descuentos especiales que ofrecen los proveedores, cuando el dinero está en las manos del comprador.
texts.en:
Jineth, 37, is a married woman and the mother of three children whose ages range from 3 to 10 years.  They live in the city of Soledad, 15 minutes from Barranquilla.   She works there making foam crafts with her own hands.  She also manufactures disinfectant and also works making pastries.  

She started her business five years ago with $200,000 COP her father gave her that she used to buy bedspreads, towels and clothes.  Two years ago she started her work with foam after completing a course where she learned these techniques.  She very quickly became known because of the quality of her work.  Various products are requested from her for various occasions like children’s parties and weddings.  She also makes decorations and souvenirs that are very useful for interior home decorating using this same technique.

Five months ago she learned how to make pastries and added them to her business, especially ‘arroz con leche’ [rice with milk] that she distributes in her neighborhood among small merchants, nearby families and also in the market among the customer she’s kept for the last five years and that are increasing more every day thanks to her good quality and service.

At present she wants to open a small variety store where she can display the beautiful hand-made crafts she makes and that it can become a social gathering center for her community.  Jineth is applying for a Kiva loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make foam crafts that she needs to buy in large amounts to qualify for discounts offered by suppliers when buyers can pay cash.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Ramon Alcides

texts.es:
Ramón, está solicitando un préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio y por la buena atención que ha recibido hasta el momento, se comprará variedad de ropa para poder salir a vender también comprará queso que es  una opción para ir incrementando el negocio.
Su experiencia en el negocio le permiten trabajar con prestasmo, con el anterior le permitió tener el aporte para la reparacion de la motocicleta, ayudandole a atender un mayor número de clientes y de esta misma manera ha logrado tener mejores ingresos, considera ir creciendo y poco a poco cambiando las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Ramón is requesting a loan because he needs to further invest in his business.  He will buy a variety of clothing to go out and sell.  He will also buy cheese which will be a way of increasing his business.

Ramón's experience in his business allows him to work with loans.  His previous loan allowed him to repair his motorcycle, which helped him to serve a larger number of customers.  This improved his income.  He plans to continue growing his business and gradually improving his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cheese

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic, a net and a drip irrigation system

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 16 years.  

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people but on retail. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow into a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, transport and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 29-year-old married man from Ibb, Yemen. He has two children. He is an employer in Municipal Corporation. He works hard to provide for his family's needs and to send his children to school.

He has requested a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase a motorcycle. He hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle for transporting people

loans.name: Faiz

texts.en:
Faiz is 38 years old and is married with four children. He lives in IBB, Yemen. He is a teacher.

He has requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a new motorcycle to help him to transport people. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to help him transport people

loans.name: Basam

texts.en:
Basam is a 22-year-old single man who has run an Internet café for one year. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He offers Internet access and phone accessories to his customers, who are mostly teenagers. Over the years, he has succeeded in building a respectful reputation for his place, whilst maintaining quality service and competitive prices. 

He is always keen on developing and expanding his business. He has already saved some money, and he is applying for a Youth Loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to get the rest of what he needs. He will use the loan to buy new computers.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his business

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya, 28, is married man with two children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He’s taken on the role of head of family.

Yahya is a soldier. He’s responsible, which is why he’s been able to move his family forward. He has a house and he’s asking for a youth loan of YER 200,000 from AMB to buy wood for his house. With this he will be able to offer better security for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for his house

loans.name: Nila Esther

texts.es: Nila de 43 años de edad compró calzado, ropa perfumería, cosméticos al por mayor y ganó descuentos que trasladó en precio a sus clientes. Ahora necesita un fondo de efectivo nuevamente para atender a una clientela que reactivó, pues de ella tiene encargos de ropa femenina, calzado y accesorios femeninos y eso lo logrará si acude a un nuevo credikiva para comprarlo nuevamente a un precio especial. Su mensaje a los financiadores es que está muy agradecida con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y quiere seguir contando con ese apoyo financiero para continuar prosperando con su negocio y en su familia.
texts.en:
Nila, 43, bought shoes, clothes, perfume and cosmetics at wholesale qualifying for discounts that she passed on to her customers.  Now she needs cash again to take care of customers she’s reactivated since she has pending orders for women’s clothes, shoes and women’s accessories and she will be able to do so if she has access to a new Kiva loan to buy it again at a special price.

Her message to lenders is that she’s very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and that she wants to continue to rely on this financial support in order to continue making progress with her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and women's accessories.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder darle mantenimiento al negocio de productos medicinales, su intención es comprarse una variedad de productos omnilife y cuenta con una amplia gama de medicamentos para diferentes enfermedades, esta marca reconocida y le ha ayudado a atraer una gran porción de clientes.

Su experiencia con el credito anterior fue positiva, logrando mayor número de medicamentos y poder abarcar a un mejor número de clientes, él considera tener mejores ventas y de la misma manera mejores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan for his business selling medicinal products.  His intention is to buy a variety of Omnilife products so that he has a wide range of medicines for different illnesses.  This well-known brand has helped him to attract a large number of customers.

Juan's experience with his previous loan was positive.  He managed to buy more medicines and was able to gain more customers.  He hopes to achieve better sales and better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines

loans.name: Karla Raquel

texts.es:
Karla, necesita invertir en  su negocio, comprándose una variedad de blusas, falsas, ropa interior ropa para niños y también calzado para diferentes edades y con nuevos estilos, esto le permitirá darle un mejor funcionamiento el negocio abasteciendolos de nueva mercadería.

El efecto que ha tenido con préstamo anterior le ha permitido mejorar el inventario, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y mayor variedad, ha estado manteniendo su nivel de ventas, solamente ha tenido algunos problemas de salud en su esposo provocándole algunos impedimentos, pero hasta el momento se mantiene firme en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Karla needs to invest in her business buying a variety of blouses, skirts, underwear, children’s clothes and also shoes for different ages and in new styles.  This will allow her to give her business better efficiency stocking it with new merchandise.

The effect the previous loan had was to improve inventory in order to have a wider variety of better quality goods available for her customers.  She’s kept up her sales levels.  Only some health problems her husband had caused her some inconvenience but to date she continues firm in her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, solicita un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de más capital para el negocio y una parte para su vivienda, se comprará pollo, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, y también comprará lamina y hierro para la instalación de un techo nuevo en su vivienda, esto le ayudará a solventar dos necesidades una en el negocio y otra en su casa.

Como el préstamo anterior logró mantener su negocio con una producción considerable de pupusas, ha podido ayudar a su familia y también está construyendo su propia vivienda, con la ganancia de este negocio ha logrado crecer y mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan because she needs more capital for her business as well as for her home.  She will buy chicken, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (ground, cooked pork) and oil.  She will also buy metal sheets and iron in order to install a new roof on her house.  This will help her to meet two needs: one related to her business and the other related to her home.

With her previous loan, Marta managed to maintain her business and produce a considerable number of pupusas.  She was able to help her family and is building her own home.  With the profits from her business, she has managed to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft cheese, ground cooked pork and oil

loans.name: Lumturie

texts.en:
Lumturie is in her sixties and has been widowed for a long time now. Her children are grownups. For the past four years she has been operating a little grocery store and the profit according to her has been okay.
