loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago  de 54 años de edad, del municipio de chichigalpa con 3 hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad la venta de productos varios desde hace 4 años que se dedica a dicha actividad el negocio consiste en la venta de : cerdos, gallinas, pan dulce y repostería, el negocio lo distribuye de forma ambulante, herramienta de trabajo que surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para sufragar gastos de su familia, en la actualidad el está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir el capital en el negocio.
texts.en: Santiago, 54 years old, is from the municipality of Chichigalpa and has 3 minor children. For 4 years, he has sold various products. His business consists of the sale of pigs, hens, sweet breads, and confectionery. He is a street vendor, and the work came about due to the need to have an income in order to defray his family's costs. Currently he is asking for the loan in order to invest capital in his business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, hens, sweet bread, and confectionery

loans.name: Emmanuel Antonio

texts.es:
Enmanuel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el negocio, comprandose productos pasteurizados como paletas, sorbetes, San wish helados, que son los necesarios para qué pueda permanecer ofreciendo a los clientes.

El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior obtuvo una experiencia positiva, ya que le dio los recursos económicos necesarios y hacer una buena inversión que hasta el momento le ha ayudado a mantener todos sus clientes, Sus ingresos en la familia han mejorado.
texts.en:
Enmanuel is requesting a new loan to invest in his business, purchasing pasteurized products such as popsicles, sorbets and "San wish" ice creams. These are necessary so that he can remain offering products to his clients. 

He states that with the previous loan he had a positive experience because it gave him necessary economic resources and to make a good investment that up till now has helped him to maintain his clients. His family's earnings have improved.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, sorbets and "San wish" ice creams.

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en: Fidelis is 34 years old, married and the father of three children who are 11, seven and five years old. For the last three years, he has been in the business of raising poultry and cows, and earns KES.10,000 a month. He has repaid a previous loan from KADET LTD and is applying for a new one to buy more cows and feed for all of his animals. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to expand his herd. In the future, he hopes to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 40 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four children. Gemma used her last loan to buy a large volume of soft drinks to sell. Her business grown and become successful, and she is requesting a new loan to buy raw ingredients to barbecue and kitchen utensils to use for food preparation. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to barbecue and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, necesita realizar una nueva inversión en mercadería para la tienda, por eso se ha decidido solicitar un nuevo préstamo que le brinde los recursos económicos y poderlos invertir en gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, dulces, galletas, y otros productos que son necesarios en el diario vivir para sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció el inventario de mercadería y su clientela aumentó  manteniendose fiel por su buen servicio, eso le ayudó a generar mejores ventas y a que su familia contara con una mejor solvencia económica, con estos préstamos de kiva espera poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
María needs to make a new investment in merchandise for her store which is why she’s decided to request a new loan that will provide economic resources to invest in soft-drinks, juice, snacks, candy, cookies and others which are the products her customers need for their daily life.

With the prior loan she strengthened the merchandise and her clientele increased staying loyal to her because of the good service.  That helped her generate better sales so that her family enjoyed improved financial solvency.  She hopes to continue growing with Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and fresh fish.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir adquiriendo el pan horneado para revender, el préstamo ayudará con los recursos económicos para que ella pueda cotizar a buen precio el pedido de pan y que le genere una mejor ganancia en sus ventas, esta actividad la realiza mezclando la venta de empanas y tostadas.

Con el préstamo anterior también logró realizar una buena inversión comprando platanos y los demas materiales para elaborar la otra venta, fortaleciendo el negocio y mejorando de gracias al crédito de kiva está mejorando su estilo de vida y su condición económica es mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is asking for a new loan to invest in the purchase of baked bread to resell.  The loan will help her with economic resources so that she can negotiate a good price for her bread order that will generate good profits on her sales.  She combines this activity with the sale of turnovers and tostadas.

She used the previous loan to make a good investment in bananas and other ingredients needed for a different kind of sales.  She strengthened the business and thanks to the Kiva loan is improving her lifestyle and her family’s economic condition is better.

loans.use: to buy bread to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 25 years old, married and the father of a two-year-old child. He has worked as a welder for the last two years and earns KES. 15,000 a month. He is requesting a loan to buy more metal to use in his welding business, and will use the profit he expects to earn to expand and improve his business. Daniel successfully repaid an earlier loan from KADET LTD, and someday hopes to have many welding business in and around Kamulu.

loans.use: to buy metals for his welding  business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 50 yeas old and lives in Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her husband and six children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this line of work for 11 years and earns PHP 8,000 a month. Lilia joined GDMPC in 2007 and is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha  Lorena,  de 33 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores, tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, el tiempo de tener el negocio 6 años, el negocio lo  tiene  de forma ambulante y consiste en la compra de  mercadería como: ropa interior, camisas, pantalones, short, blusas, camisetas, sandalias, sabanas, toallas, entre otros. En la actualidad ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora, con solvencia de pago, el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Martha Lorena, 33, is married and has two minor children.  Her economic activity is selling general merchandise.  She’s been in business 6 years.  She sells from place to place.  She buys merchandise like underwear, shirts, pants, shorts, blouses, t-shirts, sandals, sheets and towels, among others.  She’s shown herself to be responsible, hardworking and with enough solvency to be able to pay.  She needs the loan to invest in merchandise to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Celso Antonio

texts.es: Celso Antonio de 47 años de edad, soltero con 3 hijos de edad, tiene  por actividad económica una pulpería  y productos varios, tiempo de tener el negocio 22 años, el cual lo tiene  de forma ambulante, el negocio consiste en la compra de: ajonjolí, maní, soya, frijoles, los cuales exporta a Guatemala y salvador, actividad que inicio para tener una herramienta de trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hijos,  el objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en  capital de trabajo  y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en: Celso Antonio, 47, is single and has three children.  His economic activity is selling groceries and other products.  He’s been in business 22 years.  He sells from place to place.  The business consists in buying sesame, peanuts, soya beans and beans to export to Guatemala and El Salvador.  He started this activity in order to have a means of work to support his children.  The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy grains for export.

loans.name: Veronica Vanessa

texts.es: Verónica Vanessa, de  54 años de edad, casado con dos hijos, con tres años de experiencia tiene por actividad económica la venta de pulpería y  productos varios como:  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, hielo, sopas magi, cuajadas, entre otros, cosméticos y fritangas los sábados y los domingos, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa y de forma ambulante. El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo  y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo en el negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Verónica Vanessa is 54 years old and married with two children. She has three years of experience selling groceries and various products such as rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, ice, Maggi soups, curds and cosmetics among others, for her small restaurant. 

Her business is located in her house but also sells in an itinerant manner. She would like the financing to invest in working capital and in this way continue growing the business and give better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, ice, Maggi brand soups and curds, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silvia de  39 años de edad del municipio de somotillo , soltera con 2 hijos tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa usada , tiempo de tener el negocio 3 años  el negocio consisten en compra pacas de ropa usada de niño, mujer, hombre, el cual distribuye de forma ambulante, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar e invertir en el negocio.
texts.en: Ana Silvia, 39, is from the municipality of Somotillo.  She’s single with two children.  Her economic activity is selling used clothes.  She’s been in business 3 years.  The business consists of buying bundles of used children’s, women’s and men’s clothes that she then resells from place to place.  She wants the loan to buy and to invest in the business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Karla, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir creciendo y realizando mejores ventas, se comprará hilos, cáñamo, piedras de diferentes estilos y colores que son materiales para elaborar bisuteria, CD, juguetes, y otra mercadería que sean necesarias para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y diversificar sus gustos.

Manifiesta que con estos préstamos ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio, poder atender a un buen número de clientes y mejorar las ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Karla is requesting a new loan for her need to continue growing and carrying out better sales. She will buy threads, hemp, stones of different styles and colors to make jewelry, CDs, games and other merchandise that are necessary to continue offering to her customers, and to diversify their tastes. 

She says that with these loans she has been able to keep herself in the business, being able to attend to a good number of customers and improve her earnings for the sustenance of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for jewelry, games and CDs.

loans.name: Roxana De Jesus

texts.es:
Roxana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir nuevamente en la compra de mercadería nueva, agregando más prendas de vestir al negocio, se comprará shorts, blusas y faldas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, con nuevos estilos que estén de acuerdo a la moda actual, esto le ayudará a Roxana para poder disponer de más variedad y ofrecer a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo permitiéndole mejorar el negocio, manteniendolo surtido con más productos que hasta el momento le ha generado mejores ventas y una mejor condición en el negocio y para su familia, su deseo continúa a futuro poder tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Roxana’s asking for a new loan to be able to once again buy new merchandise adding clothing to the business.  She will buy shorts, blouses, skirts and underwear for women and men in new styles according to current fashion.  This will help Roxana have more variety on hand to offer her customers.

She had a positive effect with the previous loan.  She was able to improve the business keeping it stocked with more products that to date have generated better sales and better conditions for the business and for her family.  Her wish for the future continues to be to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gledys Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Gladys es comerciante tiene una pulpería la cual vende granos básicos, productos lácteos, gaseosa, pollo, carne, es casada su esposo tiene su propio negocio elabora ventanas de vidrio estilo francesa, ventana de persianas, puertas de vidrio y puerta para baños, tiene dos hijos menores de edad en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicito para invertirlo en su venta, estos créditos le han ayudado de mucho en su  vida personal y familiar ya que antes ella era ama de casa ahora tiene su propio negocio ya es otro ingreso para el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Gladys is a merchant.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic grains, dairy products, soft-drinks, chicken and meat.  She’s married and her husband has his own business manufacturing French-style glass windows, Venetian blinds, glass doors and shower enclosures.  She has two minor, school-age children.  

She needs the money to invest in her sales.  These loans have helped her much both in her personal and her family life since she used to be a housewife and now she has her own business which is another source of income for her family unit.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and tote bags.

loans.name: 25 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE JUNIO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de juguetes, venta de peluches, costura de sombreros, venta de gorras.

La señora Alicia, indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de clientas de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura, ella cuenta que inicio este negocio conjuntamente su pareja y desde esa fecha trabajan juntos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de tela) mismo que adquirirá de los almacenes de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente  a la elaboración lo venderá en la ciudad de Santa Cruz u otros departamentos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “25 de Junio” (June 25th) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Alicia, Treasurer.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of business activities.  Among them we have: toy sales, stuffed toy sales, hat making and cap sales.

Alicia indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for a year having joined thanks to an invitation from clients of the institution.  She currently has a sewing shop.  She comments that she started this business together with her spouse and they have worked together since then.

The loan she’ll take out now is to expand her merchandise.  She will buy fabric in stores in the city of El Alto.  When she completes production she’ll sell it in the city of Santa Cruz or in other Departments.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as well as possible since she’s single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO "SAN ROQUE" ES UN GRUPO MAS O MENOS NUMEROSO, ESTA CONFORMADO POR 12 SOCIOS, EN ESTE GRUPO MARÍA LUISA ES LA MAS ENTREGADA A SU NEGOCIO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA FABRICACIÓN ARTESANAL DE LADRILLOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE LO APRENDIÓ DE SUS PADRES, Y QUE ELLA A ASUMIDO CON EL NEGOCIO FAMILIAR QUE TENÍAN SUS PADRES, NOS CUENTA QUE EN LA ACTUALIDAD ELLA TIENE 02 MENORES HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE POR SU LOCALIDAD, PERO PARA MEJORAR LOS INGRESOS DE SU FAMILIA, EMPEZÓ CON MEJORAR EL TALLER ARTESANAL CON EL QUE CONTABA Y EMPEZAR CON ESE NEGOCIO QUE CASI SE ENCONTRABA EN EL OLVIDO, DESPUÉS DE UN TIEMPO DE TRABAJÓ SE DIÓ CUENTA QUE SUS INGRESOS IBAN MEJORANDO, ES POR ESO QUE ELLA SOLICITÓ EL PRÉSTAMO PARA HACER MANTENIMIENTO SUS HORNOS LADRILLEROS QUE SE ENCONTRABAN YA ENVEJECIDOS POR EL PASAR DEL TIEMPO.
ELLA ES LA DE LA FOTOGRAFÍA QUE SE  ENCUENTRA EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR VESTIDA CON CHOMPA ROJA A RAYAS.* TAMBIEN PODEMOS VER A MAGALY (CHOMPA MARRON), VIRGINIA (SACO BLANCO)Y JULIO CESAR (CHOMPA VERDE)
texts.en:
The "SAN ROQUE" group is a fairly large group which has 12 members.  Within this group, María Luisa is the most committed to her business which is making bricks by hand.  She learned this trade from her parents and has taken over the family business from them.  She says that she currently has two school-age children who are dependent on her and her husband works as a security guard in their town.  However, in order to improve their family income, she started improving the craft workshop she had and started running this business which was almost forgotten about.  After working for a while, she realized that her income was improving.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to have her brick ovens serviced as they have aged over time.  In the photo, María is the lady at the top dressed in a striped sweater.

n.b. In the [individual] photos at the top, we can also see Magaly (wearing a brown top), Virginia (wearing a white jacket) and Julio Cesar (wearing a green sweater).

loans.use: to have her brick ovens serviced

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru:
Мээрим 28 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей, младшему сыну 8 лет. Мээрим работает дояркой на ферме и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи,  7 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством с суммы в 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Мээрим в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с  приплодом, 2 головы бычков, продажа молока и мясных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мээрим обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Мээрим будет вкладывать в этом году в ремонт дома, а в будущем – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Meerim is 28 years old, she is married and has two children. Her youngest son is eight years old. Meerim works as a milkmaid on the farm and also started doing animal husbandry seven years ago which she began with an amount of 5,000 som as an additional source of income for her family. Because of her hard work Meerim now has three cows with calves, two bulls and the sale of milk and meat products which brings around 15,000 som a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Meerim has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional heads of cattle for feeding. She plans to invest the income from the loan to repair her house and to develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old. He is married to Joyce and together they have one child, aged five years. His wife is the manager of the firm at home.

He has been in the taxi business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts and also pay for the servicing of the taxi.

The anticipated profits will used to buy another taxi. This is Joseph’s first loan from KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams are to own a fleet of taxis.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi and pay for the car servicing.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo pues está iniciando su trabajo agrícola, considera que a través de este apoyo logra mejorar la producción en sus parcelas, se comprará fertilizantes y semilla de maíz y frijol, para poder realizar la siembra, este crédito le ayudará para que ella pueda tener a su alcance los recursos necesarios y realizar su trabajo.

Su efecto con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que obtuvo 70 quintales de maíz y seis quintales de frijol de esto se logró vender una parte para generar ganancias su familia, y otra parte la dejo para el alimento familiar, en este periodo su único problema ha sido la enfermedad en un hijo pero que actualmente está en recuperación.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan because she is starting her farm work.  She believes that through this support she will be able to improve on-farm production.  She will buy fertilizer and corn and beans seeds for planting.  This loan will help her so that she may have at her disposal the necessary resources to do her job.

The previous loan had a positive effect as she got 70 bushels of corn and 6 bushels of beans that that she was able to sell.  Some of the profit was for her family and the other part was left for food for the family.  In this period her only problem has been the sickness in one child but now he is recovering.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn and beans seeds.

loans.name: Liseth De La Concepción

texts.es: La Sra. Liseth es comerciante tiene un tramo en el mercado una pulpería y venta de ropa nueva, además de su negocio ella trabaja para la alcaldía es concejal municipal su hija mayores es la encargada de atenderle el negocio, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos uno en edad escolar. Se le han financiado varios créditos los cuales le han ayudado de mucho en su crecimiento familiar y personal.
texts.en: Liseth is a saleswoman.  She has a sales location in the market where she sells groceries and new clothing.  In addition to her business, she also works for the council as a town councilor.  Her eldest daughter is in charge of running the business.  Liseth is a single mother and has three children, one of whom is school age.  Liseth has received several loans which have helped her a lot with her family and personal growth.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans and clothing

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.ru:
Махбубе 42 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Махбуба работает учительницей русского языка в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи,  3 года назад начала заниматься пчеловодством. Благодаря упорному труду Махбубы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  65 ульев, запасы прошлого года распроданы, на данный момент Махбуба занимается подготовкой к отправке на пасеку. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махбуба обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку сахара и витаминных добавок для пчел.  Доходы от кредита Махбуба планирует вкладывать в оплату обучения для старшей дочери Гулнур.
texts.en:
Makhbuba is 42 years old, she is married and has two children. Makhbuba works a teacher of Russian language in the local school. She started a bee keeping business three years ago as an additional source of income for her family. Because of her hard work Makhbuba how has 65 beehives with all of the stock from last year sold out. At this time she is getting ready for going to the apiary.

With a goal to grow her business further Makhbuba has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) to buy sugar and vitamin additives for the bees. She plans to invest the income from the loan to pay for the tuition of her oldest daughter Gulnur.

loans.use: to purchase forage for bee families.

loans.name: Unión Y Prosperidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la parroquia Zhidmad en Cuenca,  esta parroquia se caracteriza por tener clima frió y goza de exuberante vegetación, en donde se disfruta de la paz que la naturaleza nos regala. Su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades las que le permiten mejorar la económica de sus hogares. Aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 14, 13, 11, 9, 7 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas están estudiando en el colegio y tres de sus hijos se encuentran en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como aserrador, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Blanca se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a cuidar a sus hijos, también cría cuyes, gallinas y ganado a los que los vende en su comunidad. Otra de sus ocupaciones es la agricultura, lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar.

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermano, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus potreros, semillas, y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.

En la foto nos acompaña el esposo de una de las socias, es el señor que viste una camisa blanca.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Unión y Prosperidad" (Union and Prosperity), consists of 7 members and 1 partner who live in the parish Zhidmad in Cuenca.  This parish is characterized by cold weather and has lush vegetation, where one can enjoy the peace that nature gives us. Its people are of a very warm heart, devoted to work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.  Many people work in the city doing different activities that allow them to improve the economic security of their homes. They still retain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is the Blanca.  Blanca is 32 years old, married and in her union conceived 6 children, who are 14, 13, 11, 9, 7 and 2 years old.  Her first two daughters are studying in high school and three of her children are in a small school in the neighborhood. Her husband works as a sawyer (in a sawmill), and the house in which they live is their own.

Blanca is is responsible for household chores and caring for their children.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens and cattle to sell in the community. Her other occupation is agriculture, what she harvests is only for home consumption.

This is the first loan she is requesting from the communal bank, from which she was invited by her brother.   This loan is going to be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for her pastures,and seeds and food for their animals.

Her goal is that her children become good professionals.

In the picture with the group is the husband of one of the members; he is the man in a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who has three children. She is 39 years old and resides at Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Teresita owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been two years in this business. Each month she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

In 2011, Teresita joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a 31-year-old dairy farmer in Kilifi. She also keeps poultry to supplement her income. She is a married mother of three children. She has been rearing dairy cattle for the past three years and she is doing great. 

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more feed for her dairy cattle and buy more chicks to rear and also chicken feed for her poultry. She will use the proceeds to expand her business further and repay her loan. 

She hopes to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her dairy cattle and buy more chicks as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
This is Amor, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Nerius, a vendor, and is a mother of her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Amor earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amor hopes to be able to expand soon. She also hopes to give her children a good life and a future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her variety store business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 61 years old and has five children. He is from Inasagan, Aurora Zamboaga del Sur. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a banana raising business. Antonio has been in this business for two years and gets an income of 6,000 PHP monthly. Antonio joined GDMPC in 2007. Antonio is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Hilda, who is in her mid-50s, is married, with three grown-up children and grandchildren who go to school.  She has been a food vendor for seven years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to build a small house; to pay household expenses and her grandchildren's school fees, and to restock her food store.  She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more food to stock and sell to more people.  Her goal is one day to be able to add more rooms to her house.

Hilda will share this loan with her loan group, "Kakakuona."   It consists of 16 members who hold one another accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more food to restock her food store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 27 years old and married to Rehema.  They have two children, ages three years and one year. He owns a retail shop and has been in operation for three years, earning a monthly income of KES15,000.

This is his third loan of KES 25,000 with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He’ll use the loan to purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, and rice for resale. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a piece of land. 

His dreams and hopes are that his business prospers and makes more sales, so he can improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 27 years old and is married to Dorcas. They have one child. He has a livestock trading business and has been in operation for four years, earning a monthly income of KES.15,000.

This is Kenneth's second loan of KES.15,000 with KADET LTD, after successfully servicing his first loan. He will use the loan to purchase a cow and two goats for resale. He plans to use the profits to invest in the business. 

His hopes and dreams are that his livestock trading business prospers, so as to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two goats for resale.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, and helps her family through managing a pot making business. She is a 43-year-old married mother of ten children, who tries her best to earn her own income. For ten years, she has managed this business and she earns about 6,500 PHP per month. For the time being, she is in need of buying more clay to use in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 7,000 PHP they provided to her. Cherry desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to use in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is from Inasagan, Aurora. She is 48 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, she manages the planting and harvesting of vegetables such as squash, which she sells. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns PHP 3,000 a month for these activities. 

Margarita joined GDMPC in 2011.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy seedlings and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for raising vegetables.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is 46 years old and a fishmonger in Miritini, Mombasa. She is the married mother of four, and she has been a fishmonger for the past five years successfully. She also sells groundnuts to supplement her income.

This marks her first business loan after she was recently introduced to KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch, and sardines to sell to her customers. 


The anticipated profits will be used to buy a greater stock of fish and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch, and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 25-year-old food stall owner in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three children. She has been selling food for the past year.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, cooking oil and fuel (charcoal). She will use the anticipated profits for the expansion of her business.

She hopes to excel in the business and transform her food stall into a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, cooking oil and fuel (charcoal).

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is from Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old. Nida is married and has five children. To make a living, Nida raises pigs for sale. Nida been in her business for five years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Nida joined GDMPC in 2007. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats to resell.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia is 47 years old and a resident of Manila, the Philippines. She is married to Euseo and the mother of five children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is always working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Senia is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. Many patrons prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Senia dreams of expanding her business and being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in selling fish.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and a poultry farmer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married, and she has been in the poultry business for the past three years with success whereby she sells chickens and eggs to her customers

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks for rearing in her farm and to sell later at a profit. 

The proceeds from the business will be used in the expansion of her business and repaying her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 26 years old and is a married mother of one. She is a private nursery school proprietor in Mombasa, and has been running this business for the past three years. Her business is doing great.

This is Veronica’s second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to construct more classes and buy new desks. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and improve her nursery school. She hopes to develop her nursery school into a primary school.

loans.use: to construct more classes and buy new desks.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 48-year-old man.  He is married and the father of three sons and two daughters.  Though he is employed, he gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Hussien has also been working in agriculture, planting olives and almond trees and selling the crop.  That has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support from time to time.

Hussien is requesting a USD 2,000  loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new water tank and solar panels for his house. This will offer to Hussien and his family clean, healthy water and create better living conditions for them.

Hussien is photographed next to the water tank and solar panels.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and solar panels for his house

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: Many cooks love a man by the name of Karomat. Why?  Because he is the best specialist of growing rice. With the rice grown by Karomat, cooks prepare tasty pillaw (pillaw is the national food of the Tajik people). He has been busy with this kind of business for more than 10 years. His wife helps him with his business. They have 6 children and try to comfort them with all of the modern conveniences. He wants to develop his business further and needs your help and support. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. Karomat and his family wait your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María solicita el apoyo para continuar con los mejoramientos que le ha venido realizado a su vivienda.  Ahora es para continuar con el mejoramiento pero se pondrá el piso cerámico en todo el interior así como en la galería, también desea terminar de enjarrar y pintar el frente de su casa. Ella ya quiere ver su casa terminada lo mas pronto posible es por eso que le quiere dar el mantenimiento y construcción en cuanto se le otorgue la ayuda tan solicitada y anhelada.
La Sra. María es modista y trabaja en una tienda donde se fabrican y venden vestidos para novias, quinceañeras, etc., trabaja desde hace mas de 8 años para esta empresa. Su esposo trabaja desde hace varios años en el área de intendencia en una escuela particular. La Sra. María además de su empleo también realiza trabajos de costura por su cuenta. Con los ingresos de ambos solventan los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo que aun vive con ellos.
texts.en:
María requests the loan in order to move forward with the improvements she's been doing in her home. Right now the purpose is to continue these improvements, but she will lay ceramic tiles on the whole interior of the house as well as the porch. She also wishes to finish plastering and painting the front of her house. She wants to see her house finished as soon as possible, and that's the reason why she wants to build and maintain it as long as she's given the help she so requests and hopes for.
María is a dressmaker and works at a store where they manufacture and sell dresses for brides, "quinceañeras" (a girl's fifteenth birthday), etc. She's been working for this company for over eight years. Her husband has worked for many years in the administrative department of a private school. Aside from her job, María also provides dressmaking services on her own. With both of their income sources, they pay for the family's expenses and for schooling expenses for their son, who still lives with them.

loans.use: to do external finishing (painting, plastering and laying ceramic floor tiles).

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Saem, 61, is married with four children and she still has one son dependent on her. Like other villagers in the village, she and her husband earn a living through farming rice on two-hectares of farmland and she supplements the family’s income by planting flowers for sale. Having been in this business for nearly thirty-five years, the current business earns her about 22,000KHR per day. 

Saem received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, four cycles ago and she has completely repaid the loans. She has successfully used the loans to improve her livelihood and has been able to afford to buy a water pump and a motorbike for her family. With a good business, she is leading her other two members to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and earn more income so as to set aside some savings for her future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 29 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and three children, who are still in school, in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming on two-hectares of farmland is the only source of her family’s income, earning about 33,000KHR per day. A lack of working capital is still her main challenge for her business. 

Chanthy has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and she successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group member who is just with VisionFund this loan cycle to apply for a loan to solve her challenge. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and use a portion of it to pay for land plowing. She hopes to make more income with good quality rice and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for land plowing.

loans.name: Las Profes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Profes está formado por 9 socias quienes en su mayoría se dedican a la docencia y a otras actividades que les permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica de sus hogares, son mujeres amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma que luchan el día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su geografía es accidentada y se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, es cuna de grandes artesanos, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Margoth,  vive por el sector de Las Pencas en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 52 años, casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la docencia, labora dictando clases en una escuelita de la ciudad, se encuentra en este trabajo hace 24 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes.

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir comprando materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda.

Su sueño es  viajar a Galápagos y al extranjero.

En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto el Señor Coordinador Regional de la Fundación. La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Profes" ("The Teachers") is comprised of 9 members, most of whom dedicate themselves to teaching and other activities that allow them to improve their household's financial stability. They're friendly, kind and very charismatic women who strive everyday in order to get their families ahead. They also keep their people's culture and tradition. They live in various areas of the town of Cuenca, which has been a World Cultural Heritage site since December 1999. Its geography is rugged and it's bathed by four rivers. It's home to great artisans; its gastronomy is very diverse and captures the taste buds of both natives and foreigners.
One of the members of this group is Margoth. She lives in the Las Pencas area of the town of Cuenca. She's 52 years old and married, and from her marriage she conceived four children. Two of her children are married and live independent lives; her two youngest children attend one of the town's schools. Her husband works as a private employee. They own the house they live in.
Margoth works as a teacher. She teaches classes in a small school of the town. She's been in this line of work for 24 years and works Monday through Friday.
This is her second loan with the communal bank, and she'll use it to purchase construction supplies in order to make home improvements.
Her dream is to travel to the Galapagos Islands and abroad.
On this occasion, the photograph also features the gentleman who's Regional Coordinator for the foundation. The small picture is that of a member who couldn't be present when the group's photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 54, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roger, a construction worker, and is a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia is a vegetable vendor. She buys different kinds of vegetables at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a wet market (fresh food market commonly found in Asian countries).  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more vegetables to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Virginia dreams to expand her business and to be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Cuencanitas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Cuencanitas está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad,  la arquitectura de Cuenca es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus tradiciones la hacen una ciudad especial. Su gente es amable gentil como nuestras socias quienes son trabajadoras y se dedican a laborar en diferentes áreas las mismas que le permiten solventar gastos de sus hogares y salir adelante con  sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Dolores,  vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene de 44 años, es separada de su esposo y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 27, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Dolores se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y se dedica hace varios años en la venta de mote choclo (plato típico de la región), aprendió a preparar este plato desde pequeña ya que sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo, trabaja de lunes a sábados y su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Nuestra socia forma parte del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mote, huevos, sal, aceite y otros víveres para continuar con su negocio. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Cuencanitas" is comprised of 6 female partners and 1 male partner. They live in various areas of the town of Cuenca, which has been a World Cultural Heritage site since December 1999. The architecture of Cuenca is a mix between colonial and modern, and its traditions make it a special town. Its people are friendly and kind, as are our partners, who are hardworking women. They're in various lines of work that allow them to pay for their household expenses and get themselves and their families ahead, all the while keeping the culture and traditions of their people.
One of the members of this group is Dolores. She lives in the central area of the town of Cuenca. She's 44 years old and separated from her husband. From her marriage she conceived three children aged 27, 18 and 16. Her oldest son works and studies, her second daughter is married and lives an independent life, and her youngest son attends one of the town's schools. She doesn't own a house of her own, so she rents.
Dolores dedicates herself to her household chores and she's also been selling "mote choclo" (boiled corn), a typical dish of that region, for many years. She learned to prepare this dish when she was young, since her parents were in this line of work. She works from Monday through Saturday and she sells her product by traveling across town.
Our partner has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years. She will use her new loan to purchase corn, eggs, salt, olive oil and other provisions in order to keep her business going.
Her biggest dream is to have her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase corn, eggs, salt, olive oil and other provisions.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 23 años. Vive sola, desde hace 3 años, en una casa alquilada en la localidad de Ataura.  
El reto que tuvo que enfrentar es muy grande, salió de casa para estudiar y ser profesional, con su trabajo paga sus estudios de Educación en una universidad de su localidad. Mantener su economía es muy difícil, por eso trabaja en pequeños proyectos de manera momentánea, de donde obtiene un ingreso económico estable. Más su principal actividad económica se centra en la compra y venta de queso, carne y productos lácteos en la capital del país, a donde viaja cada viernes y regresa los domingos. Su trabajo es de vital importancia, ya que en esos días obtiene la mayor parte de sus ganancias del mes. “Hay días en las que ya tengo pedidos, solo tengo que llevar los productos, porque ya están pagados”, afirma. 

Ella acaba de ingresar al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, razón por la que promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Margarita invertirá el dinero en la compra de más queso y carne para abastecer el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita is 23 years old. She has lived alone for 3 years in a rented house in the Ataura area.

The challenge that she has to face is very great. She left home to go to school and prepare for a career. With her work she pays for her studies in education at a local university. Maintaining her finances is very difficult, and so she works on small projects on a temporary basis, and from this she obtains a stable income. Furthermore, her principal business activity is centered on buying and selling cheese, meat, and milk products in the capital of the country, where she travels every Friday and returns every Sunday. Her work is of vital importance, since on those days she obtains the greater part of her monthly earnings. "There are days in which I have orders, and I only need to deliver the products, because they are already paid for," she confirms.

She has just joined the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn). This is her first loan with MFP, and for this reason she promises to be punctual in her payments.

Margarita will invest the money in the purchase of more cheese and meat to fill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cheese and meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been selling fish at the market for the last ten years. She is always active and is always helping her five children. She is single and independent but always makes sure that her family is not lacking any basic needs. 

Her first-born child is in form two (grade in school). With this new loan, Umazi will pay the school fees for her form-two son and will use the rest to buy fish to sell. This will make the family more comfortable and safer. 

Umazi lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She hopes to educate all her children, despite being alone with no support.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Stefany

texts.es:
Stefany tiene 21 años. Vive en la casa que heredó su madre, junto a su hijo Marlon y su hermana Andrea, en la localidad de Ataura.  
A pesar de su corta edad se caracteriza por ser una madre trabajadora, posee tres vacas y dos toros. De las vacas extrae la leche que producen diariamente y la comercializa a los lecheros que llegan a su zona, su secreto es el tipo de alimentación, según menciona, ella misma siembra la alfalfa que necesitan. Por otro lado, los terrenos donde cultiva son de su madre, por lo que no tiene mayores gastos de inversión. Le resulta rentable, pues no invierte mucho dinero en el mantenimiento de la alfalfa, ya que su crecimiento dura tres años como mínimo, es decir que cada vez que corta vuelve a crecer, aprovecha esto, para arrendar a terceras personas los surcos de alfalfa. Ahora, gracias a sus ahorros, comenzó a vender muebles los días domingos en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Le gusta trabajar en su grupo, pues las personas que lo conforman son responsables y siempre se apoyan entre sí. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Stefany invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de alfalfa, pago del arriendo de sus terrenos agrícolas y pago al personal que le ayudará. Y si el dinero le alcanza comprará comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Stefany is 21 years old. She lives in the house that her mother inherited, along with her son Marlon and her sister Andrea, in the Ataura area. In spite of her youth, she is characterized by being a hard-working mother. She has three cows and two bulls. She milks the cows daily and sells the milk to the dairymen who come to her area. Her secret is the type of feed, she mentions. She herself plants the alfalfa they need. On the other hand, the land she cultivates belongs to her mother, and so she doesn't have bigger investment expenses. It is profitable for her, since she doesn't invest much money in maintaining the alfalfa, since it grows for three years, at a minimum; that is, every time she cuts it, it grows more. She takes advantage of this to rent the alfalfa furrows to third parties. Now, thanks to her savings, she has begun to sell furniture at the Sunday market in the city.

She belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn), and this is her second loan from MFP. She likes working with her group, since the people who form it are responsible and always support each other. For this reason she promises to be punctual in her payments.

Stefany will invest the money she has applied for in the purchase of alfalfa seeds, paying the rent for her agricultural fields, and paying the people who will help her. And if there is enough money, she will buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pay the rent for her land, and pay the laborers who will work on her land

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
Pich is 37 years old and lives in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province in Cambodia. She has five sons who are still in school and are working as paid workers. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice on one and a half hectares of farmland, which they have been doing for several years. The main challenge for her family’s business is a lack of working capital. 

Pich’s group consists of two members who are both female.  This is Pich's fourth loan with VisionFund, and it is her group member's third loan. The past loans have enabled her to afford a decent house. To solve her main challenge, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully, and she also hopes to increase her yield to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Juana Mirey

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en el municipio de Telica en León donde trabaja como secretaria de un colegio municipal donde tiene 21 años de ejercer dicha labor, la que le ha permitido darles estudios a sus hijos, y mejorar su nivel de vida.
La señora Juana está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de Productos para su negocio  como Chocolate, súper conos, tacitas, frutas rellenas y cocoa,  los que le fortalecerán su inventario y poder atender la demanda, ya que la oportunidad de negocio es viable por presentarse las fiestas patronales de la localidad, . Por tal razón visito CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con financiamiento y lograr el objetivo planteado de su necesidad, y de esa manera mejorar sus niveles de venta mejores condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en:
Señora Juana lives in the town of Telica in León where she works as a secretary for a municipal school.  She has 21 years of experience in this work, which has allowed her to provide an education for her children and to improve her level of life.

Señora Juana is asking for the loan in order to purchase products for her business like chocolate, Súper Conos (a kind of ice cream snack), small cups of sweets, stuffed fruit, and cocoa, which will strengthen her inventory and be able to satisfy demand since there is a viable opportunity for business presented by the festival of the patron saint of her town.  For this reason she visited CEPRODEL in order to be given financing and to reach the goal required by her need, and in this way improve her level of sales, living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products of different flavors and in several presentations in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka makes a living selling omena (small dry fish) at the market. She came up with this business idea on her own and then used some of the saved money from her vegetable business. She says that the business is going very well since there is much activity, especially during the weekends. Thanks to her first loan she was able to open this new business.
She also sells tomatoes in her vegetable stall.  The requested loan will be used to buy sacks of dry fish and tomatoes for sale. Her dream is to make sure all her children become professionals thanks to her hard work.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dry fish and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  She is the 40-year-old mother of one son who is now working at family’s business. She and her husband make a living through farming rice and planting rubber trees. They have been in the business for several years. 

Sophea’s group consists of two members, both female.  She is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, while her co-member is a fourth-cycle client. 

The first loan helped Sophea better support her family and improve her livelihood. From the loan now being requested, Sophea, who is the team leader, will use her portion to buy rubber seedlings and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business so as to earn a larger income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rubber seedlings and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embriodery materials for her embriodery business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 40 años. Vive con sus dos hijos, en la casa que compró hace 3 años en la localidad de Yanamarca. 
Ella posee cuatro vacas de buena raza. “Mis animales son mi mayor tesoro”, afirma. Todas las mañanas las cuida con mucho esmero, pues de ellas extrae un promedio de 36 litros de leche diaria que vende a una las principales procesadoras de lácteos. Y cuando sus vacas tienen becerros machos los comercializa en la feria ganadera de la ciudad, pero cuando están preñadas bajan su producción, por eso piensa comprar una vaca de mayor calidad con la que podrá continuar con la cantidad de leche que produce y si es posible aumentar.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las abejitas” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con estos préstamos.
Marlene invertirá este dinero en la compra de una vaca lechera, ya que no quiere bajar su producción.
texts.en:
Marlene is 40 years old. She lives with her two children in the house that she bought three years ago in the Yanamarca area. She has four cows of good breeds. "My animals are my greatest treasure," she states. Every morning she cares for them with great conscientiousness, since from them she gets an average of 36 liters of milk a day, which she sells to one of the principal dairy processors. And when her cows have male calves, she sells them at the livestock fair in the city. But when they are pregnant, they lower their production, and so she is thinking of buying a cow of good quality with which she will be able to continue with the quantity of milk that she produces now and. if possible, increase it.

She belongs to the communal bank "Las Abejitas" (The Little Bees), and this is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity to progress that they offer her, since she will begin to improve her business with these loans.

Marlene will invest this money in the purchase of a milk cow, since she doesn't want to lower her production.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 56 years old and is married with eight children. His wife contributes additional income to the family. James has been in business for 13 years and currently has a monthly income of 3,300 KES. This loan will be used to purchase firewood to sell. The anticipated profit will be used to support his family and also pay for school fees.

This is his second loan with KADET LTD, and he successfully repaid the previous one. His hope is to grow his business into a large-scale supplier.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is a 45-year-old mother of six children living in a rural area of the Memot district, Cambodia. Of her six children, she still has four dependent children, three daughters and a son, to take care of, and they are in still in school. She and her husband earn a living through planting cassava and soybeans as the primary source of family’s income. Having been in the business for one year, she is able to earn about 26,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sima with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR, which she will use to buy more rubber seedlings and also use a portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more rubber seedlings and fertilizers and seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a single man who is an enterprising person who owns a retail shop located in his parents’ compound. He has decided to carry out his financial transactions with Yehu and is requesting a loan with the intention to buy items for his retail shop. He has been carrying out this activity for the past two years. His customers like him because of his jovial nature. He has been a great support to both his parents and his siblings. Rashid hopes to develop a large wholesale business and have a good family.  He is very grateful to Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy items for his retail shop.

loans.name: Pilika Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her mid 40s, is married with four children, two of them are grown-up and the two are still in college.  She has had a retail shop where she has been selling dry goods like sugar, beans, backing flour, wheat flour, salt, juice, and soda for five years now.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the retail shop and pay school fees. She repaid her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more sacks of sugar and rice to resell  Her dream is to one day be able to build her house. 

Christina will hold this loan with her loan group "Pilika" with 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar and rice to resell.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 35 years old. She is married to Henry and together they have two children aged eight and four years old.

She has run a cosmetic shop and a chicken rearing business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000. The loan will be used to purchase chicken feed and to increase stock for her cosmetic shop, such as braids and beauty products.

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid the previous loan well. Her dreams and hopes are to own a wholesale cosmetic shop.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her chicken rearing business and beauty products for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Nazorat

texts.en: Nazorat is a woman who likes to work very much. Some years ago she had a very difficult life and she decided to organize her own business. More than 7 years now she has been busy with growing rice. Her business has been developing year by year as she has accumulated enough experience and skills about the agricultural business. Now, she has her own planting land and some workers. She wants to develop her business further but her income isn't enough. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay the salary of workers. Nazorat’s husband and her 2 children help her in the business. They await your help and support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and to pay the salary of workers

loans.name: Aisas' Group

texts.en:
Aisas, who is 39, is a married mother of three who lives in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. The only source of her family’s income is cassava planting on two hectares of farmland. She has been a farmer for two years, and she earns about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Aisas’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Aisas successfully used her first loan to improve her family’s livelihood. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Aisas will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to spend on labor and land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to earn more income to make living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Phen is 37 years old and married. She is blessed with two children, one daughter and one son, who are still in school. Like other villagers in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district, Phen earns a living through rice farming. She has been in this business for several years, earning about 16,000KHR per day. 

Phen has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and completely paid back the loan while her group member has just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. The first loan has helped her better support her family’s living. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each, Phen, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and also a piglet as another source of income.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business activities and earn more income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Abdumurod

texts.en:
Abdumurod began his own business five years ago, and he is busy with it. He has his own collective farm where he grows watermelon, corn, wheat, carrots and other kinds of vegetables. His business has been developing year-by-year as he has gained experience. 

Abdumurod has a big and friendly family, and he is in business to help his wife and children. They want to develop the farm, and that’s why they need your help and support. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer. Please help him develop his business.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 44, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jacinto, a mason, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Gina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Gina's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gina dreams to grow her business and be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie came to the US nine years ago from Venezuela.  When she arrived in NY, she knew very few people.  What motivated Angie was her passion for starting a clothing business.  When she met her now husband, Ricardo de Linares, they decided to join forces and start a business together.  Angie and Ricardo have strong backgrounds in sales and a drive to provide quality clothing. Together, they opened their business, New Style New Life Inc.  Angie is proud of their business. The business has been in operation for over two years. Angie’s business thrives on customer satisfaction and word of mouth.   

Angie wants the store to be more than just a business exchange. She wants to help the clients as much as possible.  Angie wants her clients to leave her store having purchased fashionable tailor-fit pieces. She wants her clients to love the experience of browsing and making purchases in her store.   

Angie and Ricardo hope to use this loan to introduce new inventory into their shop and to purchase more equipment like mannequins and window showcases. With the new equipment, they hope to showcase new lines of clothing to better accommodate customers, and in so doing, improving customer service.  Angie and Ricardo support their two children through this business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es:
Don Gavino, sigue ofertando sus productos de cosméticos en variedad, electrodomésticos estos por encargo, en toda esta trayectoria en sus ventas, se siente satisfecho ya que ha logrado el aumento de su negocio, captado clientes, productos que vende son al contado y al crédito, es soltero y ayuda a su mama. El aumento de inventario ha sido con ganancias y préstamos en Afodenic, siendo una puerta de oportunidad.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo es para seguir comprando productos Avon y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, comprara: diez set de perfume de varón, diez set de mujer, vanidad, cremas, maquillaje, pinturas, y otros encargos.
texts.en:
Gavino is still selling a variety of cosmetic products, as well as household appliances by customer order.

Throughout his sales career, he has felt satisfied, as he has achieved growth in his business by winning customers. He sells products for cash and credit. He is single and helps his mother. The increase in inventory has been achieved with earnings, and with loans from Afodenic: a gateway to opportunity.

Today this new loan enables him to continue buying Avon products and meeting his customer demand. He will buy ten sets of men's perfume, ten sets of women's, as well as Vanidad cosmetics, creams, makeup, lipsticks and other catalog products.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, and a variety of products.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en:
Kann is 57 years old and married with four children. She lives with her husband and two single children in a small thatched roof house in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. The remaining two children are already settled in marriage and live separately with their new families. Kann farms her existing land for a living. With the help of her husband in this business, Kann is able to carry out good plants and make yields to support her children’s education. Kann has been doing this for many years.

Kann wants to help her daughter, a traffic policewoman, in her transportation because she has a lot of expenses due to the lack of a vehicle for commuting. Consequently, she would like to take out a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter.  This purchase will help her daughter use her transportation money to better the family’s income. Kann is very grateful for this loan given to help her family, which is in need.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province, Yan is a 58-year-old widow who has three children.
