texts.es: El Sr. Orlando tiene 25 años y es soltero, se dedica  al servicio de reparación de llantas de automóvil en su taller de gomeria que se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de Puerto Rico, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Orlando va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de una compresora para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el capital para la compra de esta compresora que le será de muy buena utilidad en su trabajo, Orlando enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar el rendimiento en su trabajo con la compra de herramientas que necesita y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Orlando is 25 years old and single. He works repairing car tires in a workshop located in the community of Puerto Rico. This loan is his second cycle with the institution. Orlando is going to use this loan to  buy a compressor for his business. This reason he is asking for this loan is he doesn't have the capital to buy this compressor, which will be very useful in his business. Orlando faces challenges in his business such as improving his quality of life. He is going to use the earnings to improve his work performance by buying tools that he needs and in this way improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es: Javier Enrique, tiene la edad  de 49 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar  herramientas agrícolas como bombas de fumigar, cuchillos, palas. El tiene pensado comprar estas herramientas para darle una mejor asistencia a la plantación de café y así tenerlo  en excelente  estado  y poder obtener una mejor producción y generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Javier Enrique is is 49 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children.  He plans to use his loan to buy farm tools such as pesticide spray pumps, knives and spades.  He plans to buy these tools so that he can better care for his coffee plantation and keep his crops in excellent conditions.  This will enable him to obtain a better yield and make more profits, and he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and financial stability.  

This is Javier Enrique's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with more facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm tools

loans.name: Yuseph Porfirio

texts.es: El Joven Yuseph  tiene 25 años y es soltero, se dedica a la atención de un café internet que se encuentran en la zona ferroviario de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es la primera de secuencia que tiene Yuseph con la institución y va a usar este préstamo para la compra de computadoras para su internet,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar su capital de trabajo. Yuseph enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener su propia tienda de accesorios de internet y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar su negocio y  su calidad de vida, Yuseph es una persona joven y emprendedora esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene y paga sus estudios.
texts.en: Yuseph is a young man of 25.  He is single and his business is an Internet cafe which is located in the Ferroviario district of the city of El Alto.  This loan is his first with the institution and he will use it to buy computers for his Internet cafe.  He is requesting the loan in order to increase his working capital.  Yuseph faces challenges in his business such as opening his own store selling Internet accessories.  He will use the profits he makes to improve his business and his quality of life.  Yuseph is a young, entrepreneurial person and this is the only business activity with which he supports himself and pays for his studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and materials for making furniture

loans.name: Idelma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Idelma sigue con su negocio de costura, pues en todos estos años ha captado clientes, en donde puede trabajar en su casa y ver por sus cuatro hijos, su esposo labora de operario, y su anhelo es mejorar su vivienda. El cual han venido mejorando a través de los préstamos en Afodenic, siendo su séptimo financiamiento.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara cerámica  para instalar a su sala y cuartos, logrando mejor higiene y comodidad en su familia.
texts.en:
Idelma continues working in her sewing business.  Over the year she has gained customers and been able to work from home, looking after her four children.  Her husband is a worker.  Idelma's wish is to improve her home.  She has been achieving this with loans through Afodenic.  This is her seventh loan.

Idelma will use this new loan to buy tiles to install in her living room and other rooms.  This will help her achieve better hygiene and comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy tiles to install in her living room and other rooms

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Basilia  es acompañada tiene cinco hijos menores los que están en edad escolar a los que tiene el deber de mantener los estudios, se dedica a su negocio en el mercado central de Chinandega en el sector madera desde hace 25 años.
Desde que inicio el negocio la señora  se ha caracterizado por ser una seora muy luchadora y emprendedora ya que su negocio lo inicio con poca mercadería y con mucho esfuerzo  ha salido adelante manteniendo su núcleo familiar, una de las dificultades que atraviesa la señora  es comprar mercadería para su negocio como artesanía en general, batellas, tajaderos es por eso que llego a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento que le permita comprar la mercadería y poder mantener los ingresos los cuales le ayudan a mantener su núcleo familiar  y la educación de sus hijos.
Cabe señalar que la señora  desde que trabaja con Ceprodel su negocio ha incrementado bastante  y su calidad de vida ha mejorado, en la actualidad cuenta con 43 créditos desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
Ana Basilia is responsible for the education of her five school-age children. She established her wood handicrafts business in Chinandega's central market 25 years ago. Since she started her business, she has been known as a hardworking, enterprising woman as she began with little merchandise; however, with great effort, she has prospered and provided for her family. 

One of the challenges she faces is buying merchandise for her business: general handicrafts, jewelry, and wood blocks. Therefore, she came to Ceprodel seeking funding that would allow her to buy merchandise and maintain the income with which she supports her family and educates her children. It's worth noting that since she started working with Ceprodel 6 years ago, her business has grown substantially, her quality of life has improved, and this is her 43rd loan cycle.

loans.use: to raise working capital.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es: El señor Leonardo de la Concepción  se dedica a la venta de productos ferreteros en el mercado central de Chinandega desde hace 40 años.  El señor a atraviesa con dificultad y es la de comprar  mercadería que le venden a precio cómodo, es por tal motivo que se decidió venir a Ceprodel para que le brindáramos oportunidad  con un financiamiento para poder comprar la mercadería y seguirle ofreciéndoles a sus clientes, el señor es casado y de él depende solo su esposa. Trabaja con la institución  desde hace 8 años sus financiamientos le han permitido salir adelante mantener el sustento de su familia, ha mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leonardo de la Concepción has been selling hardware in Chinandega's central market for 40 years. His challenge is buying merchandise at reasonable prices; therefore, he decided to approach Ceprodel for funding to purchase merchandise and continue selling to his customers.

He is married, and only his wife depends on him financially. He has been working with the institution for 8 years. The loans have helped him prosper, provide for his family, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to raise working capital to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi runs a goat meat business. She has been operating her business for the last five years. Additionally, she sells farm produce from home. The mother of three children, Chizi constantly searches for new sources of income to help support her family. All of her children are still in school. Chizi has a very kind husband who helps her in her work.

Chizi's enterprising skills have brought her success in her business. Her aim is to widen the scope of her business ventures. With this loan, she intends to buy goats for slaughter so as to increase her income. She is grateful for your help. She is thankful for the last loan, which helped her to increase her ventures. She hopes to repay her loan on time and take another loan, with the focus of moving forward.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes and onions as well as other things like cooking oil.  Esther has been in this business for five years. She wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers. Therefore, Esther will use her loan from Kiva to expand her inventory so that she can better satisfy her customers' requests. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Watheq

texts.en:
Watheq, age 26, is from the village of Nablus-jamaeen.

He has owned a bookstore where he sells books, stationary and computer accessories since 2010. His store is the only one of its kind in the area.

Watheq has asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy more stationary, school materials and computer accessories.

Watheq hopes to develop his project and improve his income as well as have one big bookstore in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stationary, school materials and computer accessories to sell in his bookstore.

loans.name: Yaninna Alicia

texts.es: La Señorita Yaninna tiene 22 años, se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos en su  ferretería que se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de El Torno, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Yaninna  va a usar este préstamo para ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece en su ferretería su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta d capital para la compra de variedad de productos, Yaninna enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para ir mejorando la atención de su clientela, Yanina es una  joven emprendedora trabajadora con ganas de superación desea seguir estudiando se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Yaninna, 22, sells a variety of items in her hardware store located in El Torno. This loan is her first with the institution. Yaninna will use the loan to expand the range of products she offers in her hardware store. She is requesting the loan because she lacks the working capital to offer more items.

Yaninna faces business challenges, including improving her quality of life. She will use the profits to continue improving customer service. Yaninna is a hardworking, young entrepreneur who wants to succeed. She wants to continue her education and is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered to her.

loans.use: to expand the range of products offered in her hardware store.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 62 years old. She has five children, all of whom attend school. 

Julienne has requested a loan so she can buy more beans to sell. She has been in this business for five years. 

With the profits from the business, she will increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a hairdresser at Yabiw, near Takoradi. She  has been a hairdresser for 19  years.   

Helena is married with three children. Her husband is a welder. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills.  

Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams and extensions as well as a hair dryer for her salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams and extensions.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a woman who likes flowers and trees. She is very good-natured. From early morning till late evening during four years, she has worked as a gardener in the National Park. She likes her work very much. She grows different kinds of flowers and they are very beautiful. 

She has a lovely husband and three smart children. Her family needs a new house, which they are building now, but she has not enough money to continue the building of her house. That’s why she is asking for a loan to buy building materials. 

She awaits your help and support. Please, help her family to live in a new house.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 33-year-old married man who has three children. He owns a small place where he makes hot beverages like coffee, tea, herbal and other drinks and sells them to his customers. He asked Ryada for these funds to improve the work space and buy materials and utensils.

His ambition is to enlarge his premises and have an employee who helps him, which will lead to improving his income and resume the education of his children.

loans.use: to improve the work space and buy materials and utensils.

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.en: Murodbek is a successful businessman. For more than 4 years he has been busy with his agriculture business. He grows onions and other kinds of vegetables. He likes his job very much and that’s why he works with pleasure. He is in business to provide for his lovely wife and his brother. Murodbek tries to comfort his children with all modern conveniences. He is going to develop his business but his income isn’t enough. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sylivie

texts.en: Sylivie is 22 years old. She has two children between the ages of two and five years old. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past ten years. With the loan she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as maize and rice for resale. She will use the profits from the business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a merchant. She sells cashew nuts at one of the busy markets. She’s asking Yehu for a loan to invest in her cashew nut business in view of expanding it. She has requested a loan with both Yehu and Kiva and has successfully repaid it. With this second loan, she wants to buy sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

What Fatuma expects is to attract new customers taking full advantage of the location she has, which is at a strategic place in the market, a place that’s very busy, which is very beneficial because every day large numbers of people come to this big market.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca has been selling fabric for 3 years. She lives with her husband and 3 children at Yabiw near Takoradi. She currently uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Rebecca will use her loan to purchase a variety of fabrics. With the new profits, she will continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sakhorn is 38 years old and lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of the Banteay Meanchey province, and she has four children, three daughters and one son, who are dependent on her and in school. She has been working in her rice field for five years and supplements her income by also working as a paid worker to support the family. She can earn about 15,000 KHR per day from her current business.

Sakhorn's group consists of three female members, all of whom have been with VisionFund for five cycles and have successfully paid back their loans. The past loans have helped Sokhorn to live with sufficient foods and to keep the children in school. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR600,000 each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 25 years old. She has two children aged one and four years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more beers for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more beer for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos sigue trabajando de albañil y soldaduria, con muchos años en el oficio, su esposa le apoya con los gastos ya que tienen una pequeña pulpería y venta de tortillas, ambos dando estudios a sus tres hijos, y con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda.
Con este nuevo préstamo don Carlos, terminara de poner las verjas en su porche, ya que le había puesto maya a una parte para seguridad, lo que comprara materiales como: hierro, tubo, soldadura, cemento, arena para hacer e instalar las verjas, ahorrando mano de obra al hacerla el mismo. Lo que vendrá a reguardar a su familia al tener una casa mas segura.
texts.en: Don Carlos has long made his living from welding and construction work, work that he's still doing.  His wife operates a corner grocery and makes and sells tortillas to help with family expenses.  They are working hard to ensure that their children can go to school and have a better life.  Carlos has already installed security fencing around his porch and he's applying for a loan now to add an iron gate.  He needs materials--iron bar, tubing, solder, cement and sand--to complete the project.  He'll save on labor by doing the work himself.  The investment will make his family safer.

loans.use: to buy materials for house improvement project.

loans.name: Wangnina 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINA 7 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Gilbert, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Gilbert est âgé de 25 ans et est mariée à une marchande du nom de Aminath. Le couple a deux enfants, tous à leur charge dont un est leur propre enfant. Gilbert vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Gilbert a peu fréquenté l’école mais a  appris le métier de frigoriste, activité qu’il exerce depuis un an et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. En dehors de cette activité, Gilbert vend des pièces frigorifiques. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Gilbert désire auprès de  ALIDé, un premier crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINA 7.
texts.en: The Wangnina 7 group is made up of three friends who live in the same district. The representative of this group, whose name is Gilbert, is the one with his hand raised in the photo. He is 25 years old and married to a merchant by the name of Aminath. The couple has two children, both in their care and one of which is their own child. Gilbert lives with his wife and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. Gilbert attended school very little but learnt the refrigeration trade and has been practising this profession for a year; it procures him a non-negligible income. Apart from this, Gilbert also sends refrigerator parts. This enables him to respond to his family's needs without any great difficulty. With a view to responding better to customer demand he would like to boost his stock and increase his business volume. In order to do this he would like to obtain a first loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the Wangnina 7 group.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator parts.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena is a food vendor. She cooks banku (a fermented corn/cassava dough cooked in hot water), which she sells at Yabiw near Takoradi.  She serves her banku with soup, stew or pepper sauce, and fish. Mena is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their children.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, an ingredient needed for the preparation of banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is married and has two children, ages six and ten. She sells charcoal and has been selling charcoal for five months. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a chop bar (food stall or shop where a variety of African dishes are sold), which she has done for 10 years. The foods she serves  are  fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls.  She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the food she sells. With the new profit, Efua  plans to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Kamariddin

texts.en: Kamariddin is a man who likes to work very hard. He has been busy with the agriculture business for more than 12 years. He grows cotton. Cotton is the main source of income of Tajik people and that’s why he chose this kind of business. In this way Kamariddin improves his standard of living. His family loves him very much because he is a careful father and husband. He wants to develop his business further but his income isn't enough to do so. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he works. He awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y una hija     actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar  semillas para sembrar hortalizas y además ayudarse en la mano de obra para limpiar el terreno y comprar los insumos que vaya a necesitar. El tiene pensado producir hortalizas para venderlas en el mercado local y lugares aledaños  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Antonio, 38, is married and lives with his wife and daughter.  He will use part of this loan to buy seeds to grow a vegetable crop and the rest to pay for extra labor and the other supplies he needs for his next planting.  He decided to grow vegetables and other garden produce because he can sell them at local markets.  The investment will increase his earnings and, in turn, his quality of life.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He's never taken a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has funded this loan at a much lower cost than anything available to him before.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal selling business. She buys animals such as sheep and goats in their early age, grows them by giving them good quality food, and sells to butchers for a profit. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident about her business's success after investing the loan.

Violet is a very active lady and also supports her husband fully in his farming business. With the loan, she will buy young goats and sheep for selling at a profit for the Eid holiday, which is approaching.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for her animal selling business

loans.name: Sorry Heart Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sorry Heart” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, earn more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is 43 years old. She was born in Koidu city, where she currently resides with her husband and four children. Her husband is a house builder and her children attend primary and secondary school. For five years now, Aminata has been selling rice, cassava, potatoes, yams, etc. With this loan, she will buy rice, cassava, potatoes, yams, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward.

loans.use: to buy rice, cassava, potatoes, yams, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Soliath Arike

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Soliath Arike est une célibataire et vend des garnitures, des brosses à dent et d'autres articles depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la sous région et sa clientèle est constituée des béninoises et des togolaises. En vue de satisfaire les besoins ses clients et d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Le présent financement lui permettra de renforcer son stock et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Soliath Arike, aged 29, is unmarried and has been selling trim, toothbrushes, and other items for a few years. She gets her supplies from the market in her sub-region, and her customer base is composed of Beninese and Togolese. With the aim of meeting the needs of her customers and to increase her buying power, she requested and obtained financing at Finadev. The present financing will enable her to bolster her stock and to support herself.

loans.use: to buy 14 dozen pads, 2 roles of trim, and 5 dozen toothbrushes

loans.name: Les Anges De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Gerard est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Anges de Ouanaminthe. Il est marié et il a 4 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Il  a dirigé son commerce pendant les dernières 6 années. Gerard  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans la vente de chaussures de sport.

Gerard espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, les produits divers,  et cosmetologie.

Gerard dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d,achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit. Gerard  dit que son but principal  pour obtenir un plus grand commerce avec l`aide de DIEU.
texts.en:
Gerard is the coordinator of his group Les Anges de Ouanaminthe. He is married and has four children. He lives in northern Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

He has managed his business for the last six years. Gerard would like to use this loan to invest in selling sports shoes. 

Gerard hopes that this loan will help him to have a larger business. Some other members of his group have need of a loan for such businesses as charcoal, general merchandise, and cosmetology. 

Gerard says his main challenges are a lack of purchasing and too many people having asked him for credit. Gerard says that his main goal is to have a larger business with God's help.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años. Vive, desde hace 25 años, en la casa que cuida de sus padres, ubicada en la localidad de Chalampampa, junto a su esposo Aquiles y sus cuatro hijos.
Su principal ingreso económico es la crianza de vacas, cuenta con cinco ejemplares. Comenzó hace algunos años con una sola, ahí aprendió que tenía que cuidarlas muy bien para que produzcan buena leche. Tenía que sembrar ella misma el pasto que comen, además de alimentarlas para que den buena leche, poco a poco fue comprando una por una, de acuerdo a sus ahorros y su ganancia. Ahora sus vacas le producen, cada una, 12 litros de leche; una parte la vende a una empresa procesadora y la otra la utiliza para la elaboración de queso, que comercializa entre sus vecinos. María sueña con poseer más ganando y de esa manera obtener más ganancias.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y a luchar por sus objetivos. En su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión. 

María invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de una vaca lechera de calidad, pues no quiere que baje la producción de leche que tiene.
texts.en:
For 25 years, Maria, 52, has lived with her husband, Aquiles, and their four children in a house that she received from her parents.
Maria operates a dairy business.  She started the business with one cow several years ago and gradually learned what was required to care for cows and produce a good product.  She's built up her herd in the years since, saving what she could and using her earnings to buy more cows.  She now has five head.  She feeds her cows grass that she grows herself because that's how she gets the best milk.  Each cow now produces 12 liters of milk, part of which she sells to a milk processor and the rest she keeps for making cheese that she sells to local people.

Maria belongs to the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank.  This is her eighth MFP loan and she has learned over the years to scrimp and save for what she wants.  Belonging to a community bank has taught her to be responsible and meet her obligations to repay her loans according to the agreements she makes with the group.

Maria will use this loan to buy another milk cow and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Sokan Josephine

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Sokan Josephine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont un est encore à charge. Elle vend des petits sacs de riz, de l'huile rouge et des boîtes de conserve depuis 03 ans. Elle fait ses achats au Bénin et à l'extérieur. Face à la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev afin d'accroitre son revenu additionnel. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de contribuer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants et d'épargner.
texts.en: Sokan Josephine, aged 50, is married and the mother of four children, of whom one is still in her care. Sokan Josephine has been selling small bags of rice, red oil, and canned foods for three years. She makes her purchases in Benin and abroad. In face of the strong demand from her ever-growing customer base, she requested and obtained assistance from Finadev to increase her additional revenues. The profit gained will enable her to help with her children's professional training and to save money.

loans.use: to buy a box of spaghetti, 2 boxes of sardines, 3 boxes of soaps, and 8 boxes of milk

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 65-year-old married woman from Catagbacan, Loon, Bohol. She has two adult children. Erlinda has been raising hogs for two years now.  She is requesting for a 12,000 PHP loan to sustain the needs of her business. She plans to use the loan to buy piglets to raise, feed, and fatten. Erlinda hopes that she can continue to improve her business, giving her the chance to save enough so she can look after herself even at her age. Her income goes towards healthy food for her family and other household basic needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Joy” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, earn more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Musa. Musa is 34 years old. He was born in Tongai Ngolawa village in Eastern Sierra Leone. Today, he resides in Koidu with his wife and four children. His children attend primary and secondary school. For eight years now, Musa has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes, bags, belts, etc. With this loan, Musa will buy ready-to-wear-clothes, bags, belts, etc. at wholesale prices to add to his business.

Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edward.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes, bags, belts, etc. at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.name: Elsa Marivel

texts.es: Elsa ha vivido en Isla Trinitaria desde que nació, vive con sus padres quienes la apoyan por ser madre soltera, cerca de su casa mantiene una tienda de venta de calzado. Su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos ya que vive en una zona regenerada por el estado. En su venta de zapatos lleva trabajando años pero lo realizaba de puerta a puerta visitando a los clientes y como le iba bien decidio alquilar un local a las afueras de su barrio para abrir su negocio de manera estable. Para Elsa su mayor problema es la temporada de invierno ya que bajan sus ventas y la competencia que es dura sobre todo porque se encuentra en un sector comercial. Con el crédito que está solicitando va a comprar calzado para tener en stock y de esa manera poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elsa has been living in Isla Trinitaria since the day she was born. She is a single mother and she lives with her parents who support and help her. She runs a shop located close to her house, and she sells shoes. Her house is made of cement and it is equipped with all basic services, as it is located in an area that has been regenerated by the State. She has been engaged in selling shoes for many years, working at first as a street vendor and going to her customers’ houses. As things were going well she decided to rent a shop just outside her neighborhood in order to run an established activity. Elsa’s greatest problems are the winter season because her sales decrease, and the competition she is challenged by, given as it is that her activity is located in a commercial area. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes in order to stock up her inventory to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy shoes to stock up her inventory.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La Sra. Miriam tiene 45 años tiene 2 hijos que son uno de 8  años y otra hija de 25 años que ya no depende de ella, la Sra. Miriam se dedica al tejido manual de blusas de hilo su taller de tejido se encuentran en su misma casa que está en la zona Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Miriam va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de hilo al por mayor para su negocio su razón para solicitar este préstamo es porque a la señora le urge tener este material ya que tiene un pedido de blusas tejidas que tiene que entregar la Sra. Miriam enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de pago de algunas clientas a las que ella deja a crédito y va a utilizar los beneficios para comprar más hilo para tejer mas blusitas, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su hija para que también incursione en este negocio.
texts.en: Miriam is 45 years old. She has 2 children. One is a boy who is 8 years old, and the other is a daughter who is 25 years old and no longer dependent on her. Miriam knits shirts by hand out of yarn. Her workshop is in her own house, which is in the Villa Fátima area. This is her first loan cycle in the institution. Miriam is going to use the loan to purchase wholesale yarn for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is because she has a pressing need for this material, since she has an order for knitted shirts that she has to deliver. Miriam confronts challenges in her business, such as lack of payment from some customers to whom she extends credit. She is going to use the loan to buy more yarn in order to knit more shirts. Her desire for her business is to grow more and help her daughter so that she can also start in this business.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale yarn for her business

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 25 years old, married and lives in the small village of Ukhuti in West Georgia with her husband, her one year old son and parents and grandmother, who is a pensioner. Her husband works in construction and the other family members run an agricultural business. They have livestock and a plot of land where they grow vine-trees, nuts and tomatoes. They work hard on this plot during the spring and summer to get a good harvest, which they sell in their town's local market. The family earns 700 Lari a month. Their income is hardly enough to provide food for six people, and they are unable to set aside money to buy needed household goods or renovate their house. 

They are applying for a loan to buy fertilizer so they can increase the productivity of their land and grow more tomatoes. They believe that doing this will increase their income and leave them with enough money to buy needed household goods and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a farm.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 44 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in that business for 20 years. With the loan, she wants to add more foodstuffs such as sorghum and beans for sale. She plans to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 34 years old. She is married and lives in Kutaisi District with her family: husband – Shermadin, two sons (18 and 20 years old) and mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. The family earns their living through their agricultural business. They have milking cows and pigs. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. The family owns a plot of land as well, where nuts are grown. They sell approximately 300kg of nuts per season. 

Eter requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers. Eter and her family members will work hard on their plot to get a good harvest. According to their estimation, after fertilizing and cultivating they will get more nuts and will sell them for a good price. The income of the family will increase and Eter will be able to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cultivate the land

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is 26 years old. She lives in a small village of Kobuleti District with her family: two children (6 and 8 years old), father-in-law, daughter-in-law and nephew. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They have 2 milking cows and produce dairy food: cheese, yogurt and curds. The family also owns a citrus garden and a plot of land, where they grow nuts, potatoes and maize. They work hard during spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They sell harvested products on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 450 Lari.

Lena requested a loan for purchasing an additional milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more dairy food. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business. As a result of the above mentioned, living conditions of the family will be improved. Lena hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 34 years old, married and lives in a small village in the Kobuleti District with her husband Gocha and parents-in-law, who are pensioners. Gocha works in construction while Khatuna runs a farm where she has a milking cow she uses to make cheese, a citrus garden and 200 nut trees. Khatuna and Gocha sell their produce in a local open market. Their total average monthly income is 700 Lari.

Khatuna is requesting a loan to buy an additional milk cow so that she can produce and sell more cheese. By expanding her business, she will be able to increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new cow.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 41 años. Vive en la casa que compró hace 14 años, en la localidad de Pampas, junto a su esposo Alberto y sus dos hijos.  
Hace 4 años comenzó a vender helados en un pequeño local que alquila en su localidad que se ubica en una concurrida calle. Cuando se inició, nadie vendía helados, por eso comenzó con este negocio, le va muy bien, pues ya es conocida y tiene clientes que la prefieren. Ahora desea comprar más máquinas para poder vender en otros puntos de la cuidad. Así también, como buena mujer del campo, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, olluco en unos terrenos alquilados. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP y en todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos. En su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Eugenia invertirá este dinero en la compra de barquillos (por cientos) para la venta de sus helados.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 41 years old. She lives in the house she bought 14 years ago in the town of Pampas with her husband Alberto and her two children.

Four years ago, she started selling ice cream in a small store that she rents on a busy street in her town. When she started, nobody sold ice cream, and that's why she started with this business. It is going very well for her, since now she is known and has customers who prefer her. Now she wants to buy more machines in order to be able to sell in other parts of the city. Also, like a good country woman, she grows corn and olluco (a small root vegetable similar to a potato) on some rented farmland.

She belongs to the "María Auxiliadora" ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and in all these years she has learned to work and fight for her goals. In her association she learned to be responsible and make her loan repayments, which they bring to each monthly meeting.

Eugenia will use this money to buy cones (by the hundreds) for selling her ice cream.

loans.use: to purchase cones by the hundreds for her ice cream

loans.name: Jesulome 1 Group

texts.fr: JESULOME 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Kpèdétin (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un blanchisseur du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Kpèdétin a très peu fréquenté l’école. Kpèdétin vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Kpèdétin vend des boulles de pâtes (faites à base de l’amidon du manioc) et du pain à son domicile. Kpèdétin s’approvisionne dans sa région. C’est la première fois que, Kpèdétin et les autres membres du groupe JESULOME 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
JESULOME 1 is a group of three persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Kpèdétin (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 37 years old and married to a laundryman named Mathieu. The couple has six children, of whom some are in school. All of the children are in their care.

Kpèdétin did not attend school very much. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. For ten years, Kpèdétin has been selling "boulles de pâtes" (made from cassava starch) and bread out of her home. She gets her supplies from the region. 

This is the first time that Kpèdétin and the other members of the group JESULOME 1 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their work, as well as responding further to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and some bread

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is married and has four children. She is 39 years old. She has been in the business of selling clothes for 12 years. She wants a loan to buy more types of clothes for resale. With the profits from the business, she will buy plots of land to cultivate. She is very appreciative for the previous loan she received, which she says helped her very much to increase the volume of her stock, as well as changing her family life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mese Mese Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Mese Mese" group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kono, a town in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Bondu, who appears on the left in the photo. She is 34 years old, and was born in Koidu where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband works as a security guard. One of her children is attending primary school and 2 more attend secondary school. For 10 years now, Bondu has been selling food in the market. With this loan, the group will buy flour, rice, oil, sugar, etc. at wholesale to add to their business.

Note: The loan officer appears in this photo as well.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, oil, sugar, etc. for food sales

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a friendly and kind young man. He’s from Lebanon and is 32 years old. He’s married to Carol. They live together with two school-age children. A few years ago, Moussa started to manage the family expenses and still does. Since he noticed that his income did not satisfy their needs, he decided to launch his clothing business with the small amount of money he already had. He sells a wide variety of clothes from which he earns a fair amount of money daily. To better develop his work, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l.. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for his business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve his income. Moussa wishes to open other branches soon.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items

loans.name: Goodness Ii Group

texts.en:
Manty leads this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in the village of Karima Bombali about 56 years ago, and is married to a farmer. She is the mother of five children, three of whom still attend school. For more than five years, Manty has earned a living by selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour and other items. She and her loan group members are applying for their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. They will use this loan to expand their businesses, increase sales and improve their living conditions. Manty will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour and other items to sell to her customers. 

Also included in this photo, on the left, is loan officer Edward.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Libia Esther

texts.es: Libia  con su anterior credikiva compró materiales para la producción de prendas de vestir, como camisas, pantalones, vestidos, cubrelechos, cortinas, y bolsos. En la actualidad necesita hacer nuevos diseños de bolsos que se encuentran a la moda y deberá hacer una inversión de capital de trabajo,  pero debe esperar recuperar el dinero que está en manos de sus compradores a   crédito, para poder  comprar cuerina, tela, hilos, y elaborar productos, los cuales han solicitado sus clientes que se imaginan usando los bolsos,  accesorios, prendas de vestir que Libia les fabrica. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará materiales para fabricar hermosos productos   diseñados  atendiendo los gustos de su clientela.
texts.en: Libia used her previous loan to buy materials to produce her clothes such as shirts, trousers, dresses, and bedspreads, curtains and bags. She currently needs to create new bags designs according to current fashion, and she wants to buy synthetic leather, fabric and thread and to create the products she has been requested by her customers, who see themselves wearing the bags, accessories and clothes that Libia create. In order to do so, she will need to invest some working capital, but since she must wait until she collects cash from her customers, she has requested a new loan that she will use to buy supplies to create beautiful products designed according to her customers’ tastes.

loans.use: To buy synthetic leather, fabric and thread

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 50 años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 24 años 9 años, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos naturales, y variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de el Tejar, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para cuarto en su domicilio y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de material de construcción, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que la competencia ya que existen muchos puestos de venta de refrescos por  la zona,  va a utilizar los beneficios en tener un capital de inversión, su deseo es de tener un snak donde pueda ofrecer variedad de jugos café y variedad de repostería.
texts.en: Sra. Martha, 50, has two children, 24- and 9-years old, respectively.  She operates a fruit drinks business, making and selling drinks that she makes or buys from a juice stand in the Tejar neighborhood.  This is Sra. Martha's second loan from our institution and she will use it to buy construction materials for a house improvement project.  She plans to add an extra room to provide her family with extra space.  She is applying for a loan because she wouldn't have enough money to buy the materials she needs without it.  Sra. Martha faces various challenges in her business, the most important of which is competition from the many similar businesses in the area.  For the future, she wants to open a snack bar where she can sell a wider range of drinks and snacks.

loans.use: to buy materials for house improvement project.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a married 30 year old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife. He’s putting all his effort into his job to enhance their way of living.  In 2007, Adham decided to start his own business in construction, and has many years of experience in this field. His job consists of installing bricks for houses and buildings. He has big projects to accomplish and looks forward to taking on additional ones. 
Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added construction materials for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations and pushes him to take new projects. In the future, he plans to improve his business and work hard in order to serve his customers as quick as he can. He also wishes to improve his financial status to offer his coming children a good future.

loans.use: to purchase added construction materials for his business

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 52 years old. She lives in a small village in East Georgia with her three children, daughter-in-law and two year old grandson. One of the sons works in the State Department, the other son works in a private company and the daughter is a teacher in the village school. Naira is busy with agricultural activities. In particular, she is busy with cattle breeding and she has two milking cows, three calves and two pigs. Naira milks cows twice a day and produces yogurt. She sells milk and yogurt to the local population. 

Naira requested a loan for purchasing food for cattle and to repair the cattle shed.  She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40% in the fall months. Naira significantly saves on the costs of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. Naira also will repair the cattle shed. In a new cattle shed she will be able to keep more livestock and take good care of them. This will help her to increase her agricultural business and improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle and repair the cattle shed

loans.name: Favour Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Favour group from Kono, a town in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Yel is the leader of this group (pictured in the middle of the photo in blue). The 25-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Yel has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells rice, flour, sugar, oil, etc. in the local food market.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her current inventory.

Note: the loan officer also appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. to sell in a food market.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 43-year-old married Lebanese man, living with his wife and three children who attend school. He has worked in the construction field for more than 22 years. He works on his own, taking multiple projects on as his responsibility.  He has one part-time employee helping him complete the work tasks. 

Today, Adel is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase construction tools and supplies needed to be able to accomplish his job properly. He took advantage of his first Kiva loan and he was a reliable client, paying on time. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business by opening an office and start working closely with multiple construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and supplies needed for his business.

loans.name: Guliko

texts.en:
Guliko is a 68-year-old woman. She lives in a small village in Tskaltubo District with her husband, Vitali, and their 35-year-old son. All three are busy with agricultural activities. They have three milking cows and produce dairy foods, such as cheese and yogurt. The family also owns a greenhouse, where they grow cucumbers, tomatoes, and greens. They sell dairy food and harvested produce on the local open market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Lari.

Guliko requested a loan for purchasing wooden materials for construction of a second greenhouse. She decided to build the second greenhouse, because of the high demand for greens, cucumbers, and tomatoes. This will enable her to grow more of the above-mentioned products during the entire year. The amount of harvested greens and vegetables will increase and Guliko will earn more income from sales. Part of her increased income will be used to reinvest in their agricultural business and the rest will be used for the family. Thus, Guliko will be able to create better living conditions for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a second greenhouse.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora es comerciante de el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega desde hace 17 años. 
Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, en donde labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, con los créditos  le ha permitido incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, también los financiamientos con la institución
 Le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y tener  el sustento para su hogar. Solicita el  préstamo para la compra de   barriles, sacos grandes  y pequeños por tal motivo se presento a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento para poder comprar la mercadería que necesita. La señora  trabaja con la institución desde hace 8 años tiene 62 créditos y se siente muy agradecida ya que hemos confiado en ella como clienta, gracias a estos financiamientos su calidad de vida ha mejorado.
texts.en: Sra. Maria Auxiliadora has operated her retail business in Chinandega's Santa Ana market for 17 years.  She is a hard-working and enterprising person who starts work at six o'clock in the morning and goes until six o'clock in the evening.  Past loans have allowed her to expand the range of products she supplies to her customers.  Other loans have provided the funding she needed to improve her house and provide for her family's basic needs.  She will use this loan to stock her business with the products she sells: barrels, plastic bags, etc.  This Ceprodel investment will give her the funding she needs to continue and grow her business.  Sra. Maria Auxiliadora has received 62 loans from our institution over the 8 years we have worked together.  She says that she is grateful for our trust and that our loans have improved her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single 22 year old Lebanese man living with his parents. Regardless of his young age, Ali is doing the best he can to collect money to have his own family and children. Ali's father is the only source of income in the family and took on all expenses and responsibilities, not forgetting that Ali is a great support for him.
For this reason, Ali decided to open a poultry shop a few years ago. He also sells fish upon request and if it’s available.  He’s well known for his generosity and good products. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new freezer for his business. In that way, he will be able to maintain the food in good conditions. He notes that this will return to him high profits. In the future, he seeks to open his own snack shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new freezer for his business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 49-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and only child. In 1993, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. Her job consists of cultivating vegetables. In addition, she produces a wide variety of homemade food, which she sells to customers from her town and neighboring villages. Her husband, who works as an employee in a local school, provides the main source of income for the family. 

Today, Salma is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required agricultural tools, supplies, seeds, and fertilizers. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a large percentage, which will help her earn higher profits. In the future, she plans to open a vegetable shop and start selling her own harvested goods.

loans.use: to purchase required agricultural tools, supplies, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Abdel Hasan

texts.en:
Abdel Hasan is a 48-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children, two of whom are still attending school. He has owned an agricultural tractor with which he performs farming work such as excavating the land to prepare it for crop growing. In parallel, he has worked as a farmer for the past 30 years. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, Abdel Hasan is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip his tractor with the needed supplies and change its engine in order to be able to proceed with his work appropriately. He is very optimistic and hopes to be able to further expand his business.

loans.use: to equip his tractor with the needed supplies and change its engine

loans.name: Eiby Melissa

texts.es:
La joven Eiby de 29 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos que denpeden de ella los cuales van a la escuela y colegio, Ella y su familia radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.  Se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de venta de pescado y camarón.
Eiby solicita su tercer préstamo ya que desea comprar suficiente producto para atender a sus clientes que a diario le visitan para comprarse el pescado y camarón.
Con el apoyo del préstamo Eiby mejorara sus ganancias y por ende tendrá mas producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su deseo es comprarse una lancha para tener personas que trabajen para ella y así generar empleo a su comunidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Eiby is 29 years old, she is single and she has two children who attend primary and secondary school and who are economically dependent on her. She and her family live in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has been selling fish and shrimps for 4 years.
Eiby is requesting her third loan because she wishes to buy enough products to tend to her customers who visit her shop every day to buy fish and shrimps.
Thanks to the loan Eiby will increase her earnings, hence having more products to sell to her customers.
She wishes to buy a boat and to hire some people to work for her, in order to create jobs in her community.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2012

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimps.

loans.name: Jesudjro 14 Group

texts.fr: JESUDJRO 14 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Josiane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans. Josiane est mariée à un imprimeur du nom de Albert. Josiane arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire et a appris la couture. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Josiane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Josiane assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Josiane exerce depuis une vingtaine d’année, la couture à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Josiane vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des assiettes. Josiane s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Josiane sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe JESUDJRO 14. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
JESUDJRO 14 is a group of three persons whose members are friends belonging to the same tontine. The group's representative, Josiane (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 43 years old and married to a printer by the name of Albert. Josiane left secondary school and learned how to sew. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children and jointly ensures along with her husband that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To cope with her different expense, Josiane has been sewing for about twenty years in her home. On the side, she sells kitchen utensils and plates. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin and from Togo. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and aiming to expand her business, Josiane and the other members of the group JESUDJRO 14 are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Nataly Lourdes

texts.es:
Nataly, es comerciante, administra un puesto de ropa, del cual se mantiene y ayuda a su familia, atiende todos los días de la semana, cuenta con un número de clientes que le prefieren por su calidad de ropa que ofrece.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pantalones para ambos sexos, ropa para niños, blusas, faldas, entre otra mercadería, con nuevo estilos y colores, que le permitan a Nataly mantener la afluencia de clientes, este préstamo le dará los recursos económicos necesarios para crecer en el inventario, dándole una mejor rentabilidad.

Ella Aspira que el negocio crezca, ya que esto le dará mayor ganancia para ella y su familia, esperando tener una buena experiencia con el crédito actual y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nataly is a retailer and she runs a clothes stall which is her source of income for herself and to provide for her family. She works there every day of the week, and she can count on a good number of customers who choose her for the quality of the clothes she sells.

She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of male and female trousers, clothes for children, blouses, skirts and other products in new styles and colors, helping Nataly in preserving the influx rate of her customers. This loan will give her the economic resources she needs to stock up her inventory, thus granting her a better profitability.

She wants her activity to grow, as this will provide her with more money for herself and for her family; she hopes to have a good experience with the current credit and to be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy trousers, clothes for children, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, pictured in his workshop, appears in her Kiva profile photo. Manal is a 33-year-old young woman: she is married with no children yet. Her husband is employed but earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past four years, Manal's husband has also been fixing electric generators and selling generator spare parts which has been a profitable project. It is located in a good movement area and he has many loyal customers but also needs more support to cover the workshop costs.

Manal is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing spare parts that are necessary for fixing electric generators. This will increase the amount of work and improve the family's income which will enable Manal and her husband to live in better conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see for fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase generator spare parts

loans.name: Jesukpego 17 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO 17 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Fatimata Ida (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à menuisier du nom Bruno. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge dont un est leur propre enfant. Fatimata Ida vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis dix ans, Fatimata Ida vend des tissus à son domicile et dans un marché du Bénin. Fatimata Ida achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Fatimata Ida et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 17 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
JESUKPEGO 17 is a group of three persons  whose members are friends residing in the same village. The group's representative, Fatimata Ida (with her hand raised in the photo) is 38 years old and married to a furniture maker by the name of Bruno. The coupe have two children, both in school and in their care. One of the children is their own. Fatimata Ida lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

For ten years, Fatimata Ida has been selling fabrics out of her home and at a market in Benin. She buys her products from a city in Benin. 

This is the first time that Fatimata Ida and the other members of the group JESUKPEGO 17 have requested financial support from ALIDé to bolster their working capital and their business, as well as to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Courage Group

texts.en:
Yel, pictured on the right, is the leader of this group of five women entrepreneurs. Yel was born in Kono City, about 35 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple have two children, the oldest of which is attending primary school. Yel and the group sell dried fish in the market. Yel has been doing this business for seven years now.

With the help of this loan, Yel and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Each member will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy more dried fish to sell in the market in order to increase their income.

Note: The loan officer also appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is 37 years old, widowed and lives with her three school-aged children. She is a very industrious woman who never gives up and who works hard at selling food in a cafe. She says that times were very difficult after her husband died, but thanks to her hard work she has managed to meet her family's needs and send her children to school. Her major challenge is lack of capital to expand her business. Her goal in life is to make sure that all of her children become professionals so they have a secure life and can care for her when she grows old. Her long-term goal is to open a hotel.

Mwanamisi has repaid a previous loan and is applying for a new one to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. With the support of this loan, she will continue to invest in and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en: Jamil is a 30-year-old Lebanese man. He got engaged few years ago, and is waiting for the perfect time to get married and have his own family. He’s living now with his parents and one working sibling. Jamil's ambition is to grow up fast and better support his family. He opened a pharmacy in 2010 and has a fair number of clients. He is requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more medications to sell because this will allow him respond to his clients rapidly. In the future, he plans to enlarge his pharmacy and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to buy medications for a pharmacy.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza de 49 años de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, tiene su propia casa en donde vive con su papa, dedicándose al negocio de pulpería y ventas de golosinas y comida.
Doña Maritza esta solicitando 17,000.00 lempiras para comprar productos para su pulpería como ser: frescos, jabón, carnes, lácteos, verduras, condimentos, embutidos, granos básicos, jugos, churros y otros productos para la venta.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo Doña Maritza pretende surtir su negocio y con las ganancias seguir trabajando y mejorar su condición de vida.
Doña Maritza su sueño es hacer crecer mas su negocio y tener su carro para acarrear los productos para su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Maritza is 49 years old, she is single and she has no children depending on her. She lives with her father in a house of her own, and she runs a store selling groceries, sweets and food.

Maritza id requesting 17,000.00 lempiras to buy products for her store such as soft drinks, soap, meat, dairy products, vegetables, dressings, sausages, basic grains, juices, churros* and other products to sell.

Maritza wants to use this loan to stock up per shop, and to keep on working and on improving her standard of living with her earnings.
Maritza’s dream is to make her activity grow and to own a car to transport her products to her shop.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2012

<cite>*Churros are long fritters made with flour and water.</cite>

loans.use: To soft drinks, soap, meat, dairy products, vegetables, dressings, sausages, basic grains, juices and churros.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 41 años. Desde hace 18 años vive en la casa que heredó de su suegro, en la localidad de Pampas, junto a su esposo José Luis y sus dos hijos. 
Desde muy pequeña ayudó a su padre en la sastrería que tenía desde hace 50 años. Todos en su comunidad conocen a su padre y los buenos trabajos que realiza con las prendas de vestir, pero ahora él se encuentra delicado de salud y dejará el oficio, es por esa razón que Marilu tomará las riendas del negocio. Le falta capital de trabajo, pues en el mes de julio, existe mayor demanda de clientes, quienes mandan a confeccionar los ternos que utilizarán en las festividades que se realizarán en el mes. Lo que más le hace falta son telas de diversos colores y texturas, además de hilos de diversos colores, también confeccionan manteles muy coloridos (como en la foto). Ella está segura de tener éxito en el negocio, pues conoce muy bien a los clientes. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos. En su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Marilu invertirá este dinero en la compra de telas, hilos y demás materiales para continuar con el negocio de la familia.
texts.en:
Marilu is 41 years old. For 18 years she has lived in the house that she inherited from her uncle in the town of Pampas. She lives with her husband José Luis and her two children.

From the time she was very young, she helped her father in his tailoring shop that he has had for 50 years. Everyone in the community knows her father and the good work he does with nice clothing, but now he is in delicate health and will give up his work. This is why Marilu will take the reins of the business. She lacks working capital, since in July there is more demand from customers, who place orders for the suits they will wear in the festivities that will take place during this month. What she needs most are fabrics in various colors and textures, as well as thread of various colors. They also make very colorful tablecloths (like the one in the photo). She is sure to have success in the business, since she knows the customers very well.

She belongs to the "María Auxiliadora" ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and in all these years she has learned to work and fight for her goals. In her association, she learned to be responsible and make her loan repayments, which they bring to each monthly meeting. Marilu will use the money to buy fabric, thread, and other materials in order to continue with the family business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other sewing items

loans.name: Dossou Gérard

texts.fr: Dossou Gérard est âgé de 26 ans et est marié à une certaine Mariette. Dossou Gérard a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Dossou Gérard a un autre enfant à sa charge. Dossou Gérard et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Dossou Gérard a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire puis a appris la coiffure, activité qu'il exerce depuis une douzaine d'année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Dossou Gérard vend des appareils électro-ménagers. Dans le but de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l'acquisition de matériels de coiffure et de produits cosmétiques, Dossou Gérard  sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Dossou Gérard de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Dossou Gérard a bien remboursé ses trois premiers crédits.
texts.en:
Dossou Gérard is 26 years old and married to a woman named Mariette. He has three children, of whom some are in school. In addition to his children, he has another child to support. Dossou Gérard and his wife lives together with their children. The diverse family expenses are covered by the couple. 

Dossou Gérard left primary school and then learned how to style hair, work he has been doing for a dozen years. On the side, he sells household appliances. 

With the goal of equipping his hair salon better through the purchase of hair supplies and equipment and cosmetics, he is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fourth time. This loan will surely enable Dossou Gérard to do better in meeting customer demands. 

Dossou Gérard has indeed paid back his first three loans.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 26 years old, married, and has three children in school. She has been operating a print shop since 2008. Thanks to her hard work, Zainab's business is doing very well with a strong customer base. To develop her business further, she has turned to Yehu & Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy some photocopying papers and toner. Zainab plans to invest the proceeds from the loans to further expand her business with the aim of opening a cyber cafe in the near future.
She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: to buy some printer paper and toner.

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Umarr is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umarr was born in Koidu Gbasseh in Eastern Sierra Leone, about 41 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have two children attending primary school.
