El tiene pensado comprar  este almacigo para poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Faustino, 42 years old, is married and currently lives with his wife and two children. With this loan, he plans to buy coffee plants for his next planting, as well as supplies such as fertilizer and fumigation sprays to help help him with the work. He is thinking of buying this plant so he can produce a bit more and generate more income. He also wants to achieve a better quality of life, economic stability, and pay for his children's educations. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has easily provided him with this loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Yanina Mabel

texts.es: YANINA TIENE  24 AÑOS DE EDAD Y VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SU HIJA  DE 3 AÑOS. ELLOS VIVEN EN EL NORTE DE PERU EN CASA DE SUS SUEGROS Y SON UNA FAMILIA MUY UNIDA QUE SE APOYA, ADEMAS DE TENER BUENAS RELACIONES CON SUS VECINOS. DADO SUS DESEOS DE SALIR ADELANTE ELLA CUENTA CON NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ABARROTES, EL CUAL TIENE DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS EN LA CASA DE SUS SUEGROS. EL PRESTAMO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIO Y COMPRA DE ABARROTES EN GENERAL, Y ASI OFRECER UNA GAMA MAS AMPLIA DE PRODUCTOS. ELLA BUSCA ASI TENER MEJORES INGRESOS Y UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA Y EVENTUALMENTE DARLE UNA BUENA EDUCACION Y SALUD A SU HIJA. PARA ELLA ES MUY IMPORTANTE TRABAJAR Y SER UN EJEMPLO PARA SU HIJA.
texts.en:
Yanina, 24, lives with her husband and daughter, age 3.  They live in the north of Peru in her in-laws' house and are a very close family who support each other and have good relations with their neighbors.  Given her desire to get ahead, she has had a grocery-store business for two years in her in-laws' house.

She needs the loan to invest in her business and buy a variety groceries to offer a broader range of products.

She is looking to have better income and a better quality of life, and eventually give her daughter a good education and health.  It is very important to her to work and be an example for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a variety groceries and offer a broader range of products.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.en:
Erasmo is 27 years old. He lives in rural community in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru. He is an energetic young man, determined to improve the conditions in which he, his wife and their two children live. This is the second time Erasmo has taken out a loan with the help of Kiva, having repaid his first one punctually.

Erasmo has a business related to the raising and selling of livestock. He also has a small plot of land where he grows lemons, which he sells on a weekly basis. He raises sheep and cattle in some corrals that are located near his home. He fattens them by feeding them natural grasses and, when they have reached a good weight, he sells them to the general public and also to businesspeople who visit the area where he lives. He also sells milk in the Municipal District of Tambogrande. Both businesses allow him to help his family with expenses. He is aware that there is room to improve his businesses, which is why Erasmo is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop as well as balanced feed to improve the development of his animals. This will help him increase his income.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to improve the growth of his livestock.

loans.name: Dios Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios nos ama lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Idalia María quien se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 10 años de los cuales cinco tiene trabajando con adim en los cuales ha logrado aumentar su inventario.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de perecederos y su meta establecer un puesto con mayor capacidad.
Las otras integrantes son Meyling quien vende cosméticos y Florencio quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
The “Dios Nos Ama” (God Loves Us) group has three hardworking, enterprising women.  One of them is Idalia María who has been selling vegetables for ten years five of which she’s been working with Adim and has increased her inventory.   She will use the loan to buy perishables.  Her goal is to have a stand with greater capacity.

The other group members are Meyling who sells cosmetics and Florencio who sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy perishables.

loans.name: Maisha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kakule, conseillère du groupement d’affaire «Maisha », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 3 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous à l’école primaire. Son mari est un enseignant. Elle est sociétaire d’une pharmacie. Elle s’installe dans une officine commerciale. Environs 13 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant,elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle commença avec un faible capital, reçu de son mari, alors, son décompte final car son mari travaillait dans un organisme international. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 5 cartons de médicaments essentiels et génériques à marchander (paracétamol,quinine, aspirines, les anti inflammatoires,les anti paludéens,les multivitaminés, les antibiotiques, etc.).En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et accroitre son entreprise.Les bénéfices de son entreprise lui servent à payer la scolarite, la nourriture,l’habillement pour ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions d’autonomisation en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client, Kakule, advisor of the business group «Maisha», is an energetic entrepreneur who is married and the mother of three young children, who are students in primary school. Her husband is a teacher. She is an associate in a pharmacy. She is settled in a commercial dispensary. 

For about thirteen years, she has been working in these small-scale revenue-generating businesses. Yet she just completed ten loan cycles with the microfinance institution Hekma. She started with meager capital, from her husband, and then on her own in the end because her husband worked in an international organization.

This new loan must serve to provide her with 5 boxes of essential and generic medicines to sell (paracetamols, quinine, aspirin, anti-inflamatories, anti-malarials, multi-vitamins, anti-biotics. etc.) 

In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her enterprise. The profits from her enterprise will be used to pay for her children's education, food, and clothing. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping poor women excluded from traditional banks to become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of essential and generic medicines (paracetamols, quinine, aspirin, anti-inflamatories, anti-malarials, multi-vitamins, anti-biotics. etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Cruz lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Lourdes quien se dedica a la venta de fresco desde hace 5 años y vende recargas. El crédito lo invertirá en cebada, cacao, leche, granadilla, Jamaica, chilla, azúcar, canela y vainilla…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Luisa quien tiene una pulpería, Martha quien vende ropa y Tania quien vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “Santa Cruz” (Holy Cross) group has four hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is María Lourdes who has been selling fruit drinks and mobile phone recharges for five years.  She will use the loan to buy barley, cocoa, milk, grenadine, hibiscus flower, chia, sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, etc.

The other group members are Luisa who has a grocery store, Martha who sells clothes and Tania who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Espino lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Vilma de 53 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida y refresco desde hace 5 años e invertirá el crédito en la compra de insumos para el negocio, ya que actualmente solo ofrece desayunos y refrescos.
Ella las ganancias del crédito anterior invertido en la compra de animales de patio actualmente posee 6 gallinas.
Las otras integrantes son Silvia quien vende tortillas y Nidia quien vende maní.
texts.en:
The “Espino” (Hawthorn) group has three hardworking members.  One of them is Vilma, 53, who has been selling food and beverages for five years.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her business since she’s currently only offering breakfast and beverages.  She used profits from the previous loan to buy barnyard animals; she currently owns six chickens.

The other group members are Silvia who sells tortillas and Nidia who sells peanuts.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, perishable goods, etc.

loans.name: Elias Samuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Elías Samuel lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellos es Mauricio de 59 años quien inicio con su taxi hace 10 años y luego invirtió en la realización y venta de nacatamales negocio en el ya lleva dos años. El invertirá en maíz, cerdo, especies…etc.
Las otras integrantes son María quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 3 años con las ganancias ha invertido en animales de patio (gallinas, patos, conejos…etc.) y Gilma se dedica a la venta de granos básicos hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The “Elías Samuel” group has three hardworking, enterprising people. One of them is Mauricio, 59, who started with his taxi ten years ago and then invested in a business making and selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] he’s had for two years now.  He will buy corn, pork, spices, etc. 

The other group members are María who has had a grocery store for three years and has used profits to buy barnyard animals (chickens, ducks, rabbits, etc.) and Gilma who has been selling basic grains for the last two years.

loans.use: to buy pork, corn, spices, etc.

loans.name: Apresse Doumassou Group

texts.fr:
Créé  en Juin 2009  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Ce groupe  est composé de 05 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes au sixième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Une bonne entente anime les relations entre les membres du groupe.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye  (assise avec la main droite levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants : deux filles et deux garçons dont le plus âgé a huit ans. Elle est vendeuse de chaussure de fabrication locale et de tissus teintées, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans.
 
 Elle achète un lot de chaussures d’une valeur de 150 000 FCFA et des tissus d’une valeur de 100 000 FCFA. Pour les chaussures la vente est au comptant par contre les tissus sont vendues à crédit payable en deux tranches.

Les bénéfices lui permettent d’augmenter son épargne en vue d’avoir un crédit plus intéressant d’une part et d’autre part de participer activement la prise en charge scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up in June 2009 on the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois. It is made up of five women who all come from the same district. They are all on their sixth cycle of the Banc Villageois program. There is a good relationship between the various group members and their main activity is trading.

Ramatoulaye (who is sitting with her right hand raised) is the star borrower. She is 37 years old, married and mother to four children: two girls and two boys, the eldest of whom is eight years old. She sells locally manufactured shoes and dyed fabrics, and she has been carrying out this activity for more than five years.

She is buying a batch of shoes to the value of 150,000FCFA and fabrics to the value of 100,000FCFA. She sells the shoes for cash but the fabrics are sold on credit, repayable in two instalments. 

The profits she makes allow her to increase her savings so that she can obtain a more interesting loan and also contribute actively to her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy batch of shoes to the value of 150,000FCFA as well as fabric to the value of 10,00FCFA.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Doña María sigue con su venta de joyas de plata, oro, como la venta de ropa variada y cosméticos, negocio que le ha dado ganancias y obtenido mucha clientela, parte de su mercadería son al crédito de quincena, su esposo labora en servicios de seguridad, el hijo menor estudia.
María desea comprar más joyas de plata ya que son muy demandadas y aunque tenga en inventario, comprara otros estilos, en joyas de plata, joyas de oro puro y oro laminado, con este nuevo préstamo en Afodenic, que gracias a este medio, su negocio ha incrementado,apoyando a su hijo menor a dar educacion,pago de sus gastos basicos como personales.
texts.en:
María is continuing to sell silver and gold jewelry, as well as selling cosmetics and a variety of clothing. This business has given her income and she has attracted many customers. Some of her merchandise is sold on credit with collections every 15 days. Her husband works providing security services, and her younger son is a student. 

María would like to buy more silver jewelry, since it is in great demand, and although she does have some inventory, she will buy other styles of silver jewelry, as well as pure gold and gold plated jewelry, with this new loan through Afodenic. Thanks to this mechanism, her business has expanded, and she has been able to support her younger son by providing him with education and paying basic as well as personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy silver and gold jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Sergio Alexander

texts.es:
Sergio, se dedica al comercio de mercería, cinchos, mochilas, llaveros, él vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, su casa es propia, su negocio lo tiene instalado en la vivienda y también tiene un puesto en el mercado, con esto ha logrado salir adelante con su familia.

El está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de mercadería como variedad de cinchos, de mochilas, también invertirá una parte en la construcción de una pared en la vivienda, comprando es el cemento, la arena, el ladrillo, necesarios para poder realizar esta reparación, este préstamo le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio y en la vivienda.

El objetivo de Sergio es a través de su trabajo y esfuerzo poder generar una condición de vida adecuada para sus hijos, también poder ir mejorando la vivienda.
texts.en:
Sergio sells haberdashery, belts, backpacks, key rings.  He lives with his wife and three children in his own house.  His business is home-based and he also has a stand in the market.  He’s managed to support his family this way.

He’s asking for a new loan to buy merchandise like assorted belts and backpacks.  He’ll also use part of it to build a wall at home and will buy cement, sand and bricks needed to do this repair.  This loan will allow him to improve both his business and his home conditions.

Sergio’s objective is to generate an adequate home condition for his children through his work and effort and also to gradually make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy belts, backpacks and building materials.

loans.name: Jorge Vidal

texts.es:
Jorge, es agricultor, vive con su familia su esposa, sus hijos, todos trabajan en la casa, él comenzó gracias al apoyo de sus padres a realizar el trabajo agrícola, hoy en día lo realiza para su familia, no tiene un horario establecido pero ya cuenta con una experiencia puede realizar todo el proceso agrícola.

Él solicita un préstamo para la  compra de los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo como lo es el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que protege al cultivo de la maleza y de las plagas, la compra le permitirá tener lo necesario al inicio de la siembra y poder realizar el trabajo de una manera ordenada.

Su objetivo es trabajar en la agricultura y poder recibir buenas cosechas, dándole una buena educación a sus hijos y una condición de vida más favorable a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer.  He lives with his family, his wife and children.  Everyone works at home.  He started out doing agricultural work thanks to support from his parents and today he does it for his family.  He does not have a fixed work schedule but he has experience and can carry out the entire agricultural process.

He’s asking for a loan to buy the needed supplies to apply to his crop like manure, insecticide and pesticide that protects the crops from weeds and infestations.  This purchase will allow him to have everything he needs for the planting on hand to do the work in an orderly way.  His goal is to work in agriculture and obtain good harvests providing his children with a good education and a more favorable life for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William con su anterior credikiva compró repustos paras abanicos, lavadoras, ollas a presión y planchas, con los cuales les fue muy bien pues pudo dar respuesta oportuna a su clientela. En la actualidad planea diversificar su oferta y agregar repuestos de refrigeración de neveras, aires acondicionados congeladores pues son articulos muy solicitados, con los cuales quiere contar, por eso está acudiendo a un nuevo credikiva, Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiienter: " Un agradecimiento especial a ustedes porque la inversión que se hice con el préstamo, me fue de gran ayuda para mis ingresos familiuares. "
texts.en: William used his previous Kiva loan to buy spare parts for fans, washing machines, pressure cookers and irons; he did very well with them because he was able to provide prompt customer service.  He’s now planning to diversify his offer and to add spare parts for refrigerators, air conditioning units and freezers since they are in high demand and he wants to have them on hand which is why he’s accessing a new Kiva loan.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “A very special thanks to you because the investment I made with the loan was of great help for my family income.”

loans.use: to buy spare parts and air conditioning equipment.

loans.name: Shirley Lindaura

texts.es: La Sra. Shirley tiene 19 años tiene 2 hijos que son uno de 2  años y otra hija de 1 año, la Sra. Shirley se dedica a la venta de Dvds de música  en su puestos de venta que se encuentra en su misma casa que está en la zona Villa Fátima y también realiza viajes a la población de Coroico ofreciendo sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Shirley va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de edredones por mayor ya que está incursionando en esta nueva actividad ya que por esta época de invierno tiene mucha demanda, la  Sra. Shirley enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Shirley, aged 19, is the mother of two children, a boy of 2 and a girl of 1. She sells music DVDs in her store that she has installed in her home located in the Villa Fátima area. From time to time she travels to the town of Coroico to offer her products. This is her first loan with the microfinance institution Emprender. She will use it to buy quilts wholesale, because she intends to venture into this new activity, since now in winter there is a high demand for them. Shirley faces challenges in her business due to the lack of cash to buy these products. She will use her profit to continue to buy a variety of products for resale according to the season. Her wish is to have her business grow and help her family, as this is the activity that enables her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise, namely quilts for resale.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: JORGE TIENE 58 AÑOS DE EDAD,ES SOLTERO Y UNA PERSONA MUY CONOCIDA EN EL MEDIO, POR SU LABOR DE SERVICIO EN CARPINTERIA METALICA. VIVE CON SU HIJA DE 26 AÑOS, QUIENES SE APOYAN MUTUAMENTE EN LAS LABORES DEL NEGOCIO Y AMBICIONES DE LA JOVEN. EL CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS Y VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA. EL CLIENTE SE DEDICA A AL SERVICIO DE CARPINTERIA METALICA  HACE 12 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN LA ZONA DE CAYALTI AL NORTE DEL PERU. JORGE SIEMPRE SE HA CARACTERIZADO POR SER UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA CON VISION PARA EL FUTURO. POR ESTO ESTA BUSCANDO SACAR UN CREDITO CON EDPYME ALTERNATIVA CON EL APOYO DE KIVA. CON EL CRÉDITO JORGE COMPRARÁ MAS INSUMOS Y REPUESTOS (FIERRO, SOLDADURA, PEGAMENTOS, OXIGENO, OTROS) PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO Y SU RESPECTIVA VENTA. ATENDIENDO LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR,  AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES, CONTANDO CON CLIENTES NUEVOS E INGRESOS ADICIONALES A LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Jorge, 58, is single and a very well-known person in his community because of his work in metal carpentry.  He lives with his 26-year-old daughter and they help each other out in the business and in her goals.  He has good references and lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.  He has provided metal carpentry services for 12 years in the Cayalti zone in northern Perú.  

Jorge has always been noted for being a very hardworking, forward-looking person.  Because of this he’s looking for a Kiva-supported loan at Edpyme Alternativa that Jorge will use to buy more supplies and spare parts (iron, solder, adhesives, oxygen and others) to stock his business and for his sales thus meeting unmet local demand.  He will enlarge his customer base adding new customers that will produce additional family income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 65 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Cliente vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope  y cuenta con servicios de agua; el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 20  familias. Apesar de su edad, Rosa sugue trabajando duro y busca tener un calidad de vida digna. La actividad que desarrolla es venta de crianza y  comercialización  de animales, contando con inventario de Ganado Vacuno, ovino y aves de corral, actualmente cuenta con  3 novillas. Esto lo lleva haciendo por mas de 30 años y el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, contando con amplios corrales, cada uno de los cuales estan acondicionados de acuerdo al tipo de animal que cria. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de aves menores para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves. Este negocio cuenta con competencia, pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Rosa, 65, is married and has a dependent son. She lives in the rural part of Mórrope District; she has running water.  The place is a small community with about 20 families.  Despite her age, Rosa continues to work hard seeking to have a dignified quality of life.

The activity she carries out is raising animals to sell.  She has cattle, sheep and barnyard fowl; she currently has three heifers.  She’s been doing this for over 30 years.  The business is located at home.  She has spacious corrals there and each one is set up according to the type of animal that’s raised there. She learned this activity from her parents, that is to say she knows it to perfection.

She will use the loan to buy barnyard fowl to raise and to buy feed for them.  She has competition but also a large market to sell in.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl and feed.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor, tiene 63 años de edad, vive con su esposa, es comerciante de verduras, trabaja de lunes a sábado de siete de la mañana a 12 del mediodía, su esposa también le colabora ayudándole a vender en la casa mientras que sale a vender de forma ambulante por la ciudad.

Actualmente necesita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de papas, repollos, plátanos, tomates, otras verduras que son necesarias para salir a ofrecerlas, el préstamo le ayudara a poder estabilizar su negocio incrementando la mercadería dándole también la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos. Su objetivo es a través del préstamo fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Victor, 63, lives with his wife.  He’s a vegetable merchant.  He works Monday through Saturday from 7am until noon.  His wife helps him out selling from home while he goes out to sell from place to place in the city.

He needs a loan to buy potatoes, cabbage, bananas, tomatoes and other vegetables he needs to go out and sell.  The loan will help him stabilize his business increasing the merchandise and giving him the opportunity to improve his income.  His goal is to strengthen the business more and offer his wife better living conditions through the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Amina from Tiribe town in the south coast of Kenya. She is married and has seven children; four are boys and three are girls. Five of her children attend school. 

Amina runs a fish selling business in a busy area. She has been running this business for over five years. She started her business so as to help her husband with the family expenses. Also, her children had to go to school, and so she needed money to support her family. She works at the business mostly during the afternoon hours six days a week. Her business is the only source of income for her family, apart from the contribution from her husband. Her customer base is growing, but she has insufficient capital to operate the business.

Amina has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay the school fee balance for her son who is in form two. In future, she plans to run an international business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Faith In Action Group Ii

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the Faith In Action II Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kono, a town in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Febian. She is 33 years old and she was born in Kamara. She lives with her husband, a company clerk, and has four children, all of whom attend school. For five years now, Febian has been selling shoes, slippers, and clothes. With this loan, Febian and the other group members will buy these items wholesale to add to their businesses. Please note: the loan officer is also pictured (second from the right).

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers, clothes, etc for sale.

loans.name: Hazhar's Group

texts.en:
Hazhar is a young Iraqi woman. She is 22 years old and married, with no children yet. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hazhar is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home. Despite her young age, she has four years of experience with using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

With her experience, she has been able to gain insight into her customers' needs and she would like to improve her business by offering her customers a greater variety of services. She would like to replace her old sewing machine and buy an overlock machine, an iron, and some nice quality fabric. To be able to make these purchases she now, took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and buy an overlock machine, an iron, and some nice quality fabric

loans.name: More Tataa Group

texts.en:
Hallandtu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hallandtu was born in Makeni city, about 38 years ago. She is married to a civil servant and the couple has five children, all of whom are still attending school.  

This is first loan that Hallandtu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Hallandtu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business, adding rice, oil, flour, dried fish, etc. to her inventory to sell in the food market. 

Note: the loan officer also appears in this photo; he is second from the left.

loans.use: to buy onions, dried fish, rice, oil, flour, etc. to sell in the food market

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es:
Rogelio, vive acompañado de sus cuatro hijos, de 25, 20, 18, 17 años de edad, todo depende económicamente de él, Rogelio administra un molino de nixtamal, trabaja todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía, su ventaja es que no posee competencia en la zona.

Actualmente necesita realizar la reparación de un pozo y la cisterna la cual le ayuda a generar el agua para el molino, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita hacer las reparaciones necesarias en la cisterna y poder continuar brindando un buen servicio a los clientes, ya que le dificulta realizar su trabajo de manera normal.

Su objetivo es seguir prestando un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que esto le permitirá seguir contando con ingresos para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rogelio lives in the company of his four children who re 25, 20, 18 and 17-years-old.  Everything depends economically on him.  Rogelio runs a corn mill.  He works every day from five in the morning until noon.  His advantage is that he has no competition in the zone.

He needs to repair a well and the cistern that help him generate water for the mill which is why he’s asking for the loan to be able to do the necessary repairs in the cistern and be able to continue working providing good customer service since he’s finding it difficult to work normally.  His goal is to continue providing a good service to his customers since this will allow him to continue to have income in order to improve his living condition with his children.

loans.use: to repair a well and the cistern.

loans.name: Cleta

texts.en:
Cleta is a 65-year-old married woman living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  She has been in the guzo (seaweed) farming business for five years now. 

Cleta is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will help her to buy materials for seaweed farming like seaweed seedlings, straw, nets, and other things. She works really hard to support her family, especially in meeting their daily needs such as for consumption.

In the future, Cleta hopes to expand and improve her business in order for her to augment her income. She adds that if she is provided financial support through this loan, she will be able to buy the necessary materials for the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming like seaweed seedlings, straw, nets, etc.

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 42-year-old Iraqi woman with a life experience filled with many challenges. She is a widow and since the death of her husband she has been raising six children alone. While three of the older children help with meeting the needs of the family, Nahida works from home. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who works from home, using her sewing skills to generate the income needed for her family.

Nahida has 12 years of experience and has gained a good reputation from her work. Being familiar with the needs and likes of her customers, she would like to make small improvements to her little business and provide a larger variety of services to her customers. She would like to buy an overlock machine and some nice quality fabric and improve her work area with some small furniture items. To be able to make these purchases she is now taking a loan in the amount of US $2,500 from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.   

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and some nice quality fabric and to improve her work area with some small furniture items.

loans.name: Biankoama Group

texts.en:
Kumba is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kumba was born in Eastern Sierra Leone, about 35 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has six children, all of whom are attending school. Kumba sells small foodstuffs in a food market, and has been doing this business for six years now.

With the help of this loan, Kumba and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Kumba will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy palm oil, sugar, flour, rice, dried fish, etc. in order to increase her inventory of goods. 

Note: the loan officer is pictured in this photo alongside the group members

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, flour, etc. to sell in the market

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 27 years old. She sells beans and has been selling beans for six years. She has requested a loan to buy more tons of beans for resale. With the profits from the business, she will renovate her house. The previous loan she received helped her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan Manuel tiene 37 años de edad esta casado y vive en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque al norte del Peru. Vive dentro de una pequeña comunidad de alrededor de 50 personas y cuenta con servicios de agua y luz La actividad que desarrolla el Juan Manuel es la crianza y comercialización de animales, mientras que su conyuge se dedica a la venta de abarrotes varios, siendo la unica bodega de su zona. El negocio esta situado en su domicilio. Entre los dos son personas muy trabajadoras con ideas de salir adelante. Por este motivo estan buscando tomar un prestamo de 4000 soles. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra arroz en cascara  valorizado en 130 Nuevos Soles la fanega deseando comprar 20 Fanegas con una inversion final de 2600 Nuevos Soles, el resto sera invertido en su bodega y compra de otra ternera.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 37, is married and lives in a rural part of Lambayeque District in northern Perú.  He lives in a small community of about 50 people and he has electricity and running water.  

The activity Juan Manuel carries out is raising animals to sell while his wife sells various groceries in the only store in the zone.  The business is home-based.  The two of them are hardworking people with a strong drive to get ahead.  

Because of this they are taking out a 4000 sol loan that will be used to buy unshelled rice which costs 130 new soles a fanega [measure of grain and seed of about a hundred-weight]; he wants to buy 20 fanegas with a total cost of 2600 new soles.  He will invest the rest in the purchase of stock merchandise for the store and in another calf.

loans.use: to buy unshelled rice, stock merchandise for the store and to buy a calf.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.en:
Yode, aged 40, is the chairman of the Community Bank “Mapendo Plus” group, which is composed of nine members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Yode has been active in his business since 2002 running a restaurant. Today, he has changed his business. He now sells fresh fish at the market located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC, who has already received ten different loans and has repaid them properly. As the demand for fish is high in his community, he intends to use the next loan to increase his stock of fish and to resell them with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of US $120. 

Yode's ambition is to open a general store. He is married and has five children, who are between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his goods by buying a box of fresh fish and reselling them for a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Océan Plus Group

texts.en:
Loba, 43, is a leader of the community bank “OcéanPlus” group, which is composed of 20 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Loba runs a restaurant. She works in western Kinshasa. She makes the equivalent of $30 per day in profit. She has been a faithful client of Hope and her business has prospered. She is planning to use this loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by purchasing a box of salted fish. She is working very hard and would like to continue receiving Hope loans in order to achieve her dreams of modernizing her restaurant by using electrical appliances such as hot plates instead of charcoal. 

Loba is 43 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, five of whom attend school.

loans.use: to purchase a box of salted fish for the restaurant.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Five Sisters Unity Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Five Sisters Unity” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone (their loan officer, Edward, is on the left). They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a 2,500,000 SLL loan that will break down to 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a tailor, and they have four children. For the past five years Fatmata has sold rice, pepper, palm oil, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy food and spices at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es: Cuando Zunilda inició su negocio, su hija la poyó pues con sus conocimientos de sistemas fue su mayor soporte para salir al mercado a ofrecer servicios de internet, fotocopiaje, transcripciones fotografías y llamadas. También tuvo en cuenta el entorno del municipio donde habita, en el cual no tiene competencia pues no hay café internet cercanos;  por eso se posicionó en una casa familiar y teniendo en cuenta que su negocio ha crecido, hoy ha decidido ubicarlo en un local de su propiedad, que forma parte de su estrategia de captura de clientes. Su mayor desafío es lograr adecuar sus instalaciones, para que sus clientes se encuentren en un ambiente confortable, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a esta meta inmediata. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual hará las adecuaciones locativas pertinentes a cerramiento y cubierta y con ello lograr mayor posicionamiento. Su credikiva tendrá éxito, porque estará ubicada  en un sitio más cómodo, cerca a su actual clientela y con un potencial de captar el interés de una clientela potencial extensa.
texts.en:
When Zunilda started her business her daughter helped out because her skills in computer science was of great help for her to launch in the market offering Internet access service, photocopying service, photograph transcriptions and telephone calls.  She also took into account her surroundings in her neighborhood noting that she had no competition for there are no Internet cafés nearby which is why she set one up at home.  

Noting that her business has grown she’s now decided to move it from home into a locale she owns which is part of her strategy to win over more customers.  Her greatest challenge is to make the improvements to the locale so that her customers will have a comfortable environment but her capital is insufficient to reach this goal immediately.  

This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to do the required physical changes having to do with enclosure and roofing thus attaining a better position.  We at the Fundación believe that her Kiva loan will be successful because she’ll be located in a more comfortable spot that’s nevertheless near her present clientele with potential of capturing the interest of a wider customer base.

loans.use: to make some physical home improvements.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
Doña María, continúa con su negocio de venta de cosa de horno, preparándola ella misma, todos los días horna, negocio que se ha mantenido gracias al esfuerzo y deseo de salir adelante con su familia y mejora de su casa. Con los préstamos en Afodenic, le ha sido posible esta mejora, así como el aumento de productos de sus ventas.
Con este nuevo financiamiento seguirá con la construcción de paredes en el levantamiento, ya que va por parte, porque todo  esta ah altos costos, lo que espera terminar y poner techo. Comprara: arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, láminas de zinc y comenzar la obra,
texts.en:
María continues in her business selling baked goods.  She prepares the goods herself and bakes every day.  She has kept her business running thanks to her hard work and her desire to make progress together with her family and improve her home.  The home improvements have been made possible thanks to loans from Afodenic and she has also managed to increase the amount of products she sells.

María will use this new loan to continue building walls in her home as she is building in parts owing to the high costs involved.  She hopes to finish her home soon and put on a roof.  She will buy sand, blocks, cement, iron and metal sheets, and start the job.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Baninga Ya Yesu Plus Group

texts.en:
Paul, aged 40, is the chairman of the Community Bank group named “Baninga Ya Yesu Plus.” This means “Friends of Jesus” in English. It is composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Paul has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1999. He sells slippers. His business is located to the east of Kinshasa. Paul is happy to be one of HOPE DRC’s clients. The loan he will obtain next will be used to buy pairs of slippers in bulk and to resell them at retail prices with the goal of increasing his profits. His business generates a profit of US $100 per week. Paul is married and the father of four children, whose ages range between 2 and 8. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of slippers to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: One Word Business Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “One Word Business” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone (their loan officer, Edward, is on the left). They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a 2,500,000 SLL loan that breaks down to 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Betty. Twenty-five years ago she was born in Nimikoro in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary school. For the past eight years Betty has sold rice, beans, groundnuts, etc. With her share of this loan she will buy these items in bulk to add to her stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to sell at retail.

loans.name: Maria Doris

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de mariscos tiene cinco años en el negocio, realiza las ventas en el centro de la ciudad trabajando de lunes a sábado, ella tiene 24 años de edad y vive con su hija de seis meses y su esposo quien le ayuda también en el negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de mariscos como lo son el pescado, camarones, conchas, y otra variedad de especies que son de la preferencia de los clientes, este préstamo ayudará a poder incrementar su negocio y a poder generar una mejor condición, con la posibilidad de tener mayores ingresos.

La aspiración de María es ir creciendo y fortaleciendo más el negocio, ya que con esto podrá ofrecer a su familia especialmente a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María has been in business selling seafood for five years.  She makes her sales in the city center and works from Monday to Saturday.  She is 24 years old and lives with her 6-month-old daughter and her husband who helps her in the business.

María is requesting a loan to invest in buying seafood such as fish, shrimp, shellfish and other species that her customers like.  This loan will help her to increase her business and improve her conditions with the possibility of making more income.

María's wish is to further grow and strengthen her business because it will allow her to offer her family, especially her daughter, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and shellfish

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежде 50 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Надежда в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года начала заниматься животноводством, купив корову с теленком.  Благодаря упорному труду Надежды в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы, 3 овцы, прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надежда обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Надежда планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en:
Nadezhda is 50 years old, she is married and has four children. As a main source of income for her family Nadezhda has started doing animal husbandry since 1990 by buying a cow with a calf. Because of her hard work she now has three cows, three sheep and the income from the sale of milk and dairy products is 15,000 som (KGS) a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Nadezhda has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 85,000 som (KGS) to buy additional heads of cattle. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yohana Lisseth

texts.es:
Yohana, vive con su madre y un hermano, los cuales trabajan cada uno independientemente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa este negocio tiene alrededor de unos dos años, ofreciendo ropa nueva de vestir e interior para damas.

Ella solicitó un préstamo para realizar la compra de ropa interior exclusivo para damas, le permitirá tener una mejor disponibilidad de mercadería para poder atender también logrará llegar a otras zonas donde puede aumentar su demanda.

Su objetivo es estabilizar su negocio con mercadería de calidad, ser una buen cliente con este préstamo logrando cancelarlo de forma responsable para a futuro contar con este servicio.
texts.en:
Yohana lives with her mother and a brother, who work on their own.  She works selling new clothing and lingerie for women, a business she has had for about two years.

She requested a loan to buy women's lingerie.  This will allow her to have better availability of merchandise to be able to offer.  She also will be able to go to other areas where she can increase her demand.

Her goal is to stabilize her business with quality merchandise and to be a good client with this loan by paying it back in a responsible way so she can count on this service in the future.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie.

loans.name: Hamdije

texts.en:
Hamdije is in her early seventies and married. Two of her children are grown up and married. One of her children had an accident sometime ago, which is why Hamdije is still working: to support him. They live in a rocky village in the central eastern part of Albania. She is known by everyone in the village for her personable nature.

Hamdije started a wholesale food distribution business five years back. She would like to buy some more inventory and repair her store as well. This will be her third loan request, one for 200,000 ALL, from VisionFund Albania (kindly note that she has paid her previous loans off on time). With her profits she will be able not only to take care of her son but also improve on their living conditions.

Yet Hamdije appreciates that this loan situation is different: it is through Kiva. She is gratified by all of the support from potential Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy wholesale food, snacks and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como operário da empresa Bananalândia e tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, farinha, arroz, feijão, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja construir uma casa e condigna para a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a melhorar as condições da sua família e garantir um futuro próspero aos filhos.
texts.en:
A married father of two children attending school, he lives in his own home and does not support anyone else.  He works as a laborer for the   Bananalandia company and has his own business selling household necessities.  With this loan, he will buy products to diversify his merchandise (such as oil, flour, rice, beans, soft drinks and the like).

In the future he wants to build a decent home for his family and for that reason, he is comitted to pay the loan due and any further loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge is to improve his family’s quality of life and guarantee a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy and sell products  (such as oil, flour, rice, beans, soft drinks and the like).

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a 62-year-old married woman with seven grown-up children. For the past five years she has worked the family’s rice field with her husband. She is also investing in a food vending venture.

At this moment Antonina needs capital for the farm and her growing business. She is asking for a 6000 PHP loan from CEVI to pay for maintenance on equipment such as a tractor and thresher used in the rice field and to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes that if she can gain access to CEVI’s financial services, she will be able to support and expand her businesses, so augmenting her income.

Antonina’s ambition is to reinvest in her businesses and save money for future use.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her farm's equipment and to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 36-year-old married woman living in the town of Talibon in Bohol, Philippines. She has a two-year-old son depending on her.

Arlyn runs a motorcycle business and has had this business for 10 years now. This business provides them the income that they need for sustenance. 

Arlyn joined CEVI in order to gain access to financial services offered by the organization with the help of its financial partners. Arlyn is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP for the maintenance and repair of their motorcycle.

In the future, Arlyn hopes to invest in another business to increase their daily income. Moreover, she and her husband want to invest in a more profitable business as a way of preparing for the education of their child. They believe that it is their responsibility to provide a good future for their son by sending him to school for a better education.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle, which is used in her transport business.

loans.name: Al-Ashraq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ashraq and consists of two ladies, Ashrag and Azizh, and a man, Ahmed. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Ashrag is married, is 35 years old, and has five children who are studying. She works in a bank. 

She is requesting a loan to buy house furniture. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
MAGDALENA TIENE 33 AÑOS, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS 2 HIJOS DE 15 Y 3 AÑOS DE EDAD. VIVEN EN EL AREA DE ZAÑA Y LA FAMILIA ES CONOCIDA POR SU TRABAJO EN LA CRIANZA DE PATOS Y PAVILLAS DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS. ADEMÁS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A SERVICIOS AGRÍCOLAS EN LA EMPRESA PRIVADA DIROSE. LA FAMILIA ES MUY UNIDA Y CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS DE UNA COMUNIDAD QUE SE DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA.

MAGDALENA EN PARTICULAR SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PATOS Y PAVILLAS DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS EN SECTOR. ADEMÁS TRABAJA EN AGRICULTURA SEMBRANDO VEGETALES PARA CONSUMO PROPIO Y PARA LA VENTA EN UNA PEQUENA AREA EN LA PARTE TRACERA DE SU CASA. CON EL PRÉSTAMO REALIZARÁ COMPRA DE AVES DE CORRAL, PAVILLAS ASÍ TAMBIÉN LE SERVIRÁ PÁRA MANTENIMIENTO DE SU CULTIVO. LOGRARÁ ATENDER LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR, AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES,CONTANDO CON CLIENTES NUEVOS E INGRESOS ADICIONALES A LA FAMILIA. TIENE MUCHAS GAANS DE SALIR ADELANTE Y DARLE EL MEJOR EJEMPLO Y CALIDAD DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their two children who are 15 and 3 years old.  They live in Zaña and the family are known for their work raising ducks and turkey-hens.  They have been in this business for ten years.  Magdalena's husband also does agricultural work for the private company Dirose.  The family is very united and they have good references from a community whose residents work in commerce, farming and livestock raising.

Magdalena has been raising ducks and turkey-hens in this area for 10 years.  She also farms, growing vegetables for her own use and also for sale.  She grows her crops on a small plot of land out the back of her house.  She will use her loan to buy farmyard birds (young turkey-hens) and to maintain her crops.  She will manage to satisfy the unmet demand in her area, expand her customer portfolio, gain new customers and make additional income for her family.  She has a great desire to make progress in life and provide her children with a good example and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farmyard birds (young turkey-hens) and to maintain her crops

loans.name: Athar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Athar and consists of four members: Syabrin, Ahlam, Athar and Eyman. They are all hardworking women.

Athar is the leader of the group (she is seated in the center). She is 28 years old, married and has one child. The family doesn't own a house and so lives in a rented one.

The group has applied for a 200,000 YER youth loan from AMB, which breaks down to 50,000 YER each. With her portion Athar will buy a mattress for her house.

loans.use: to buy mattress for her house

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en: Mahmood is 35 years old and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is married with five children. He has a grocery store that buys and sells canned goods and snacks. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 100,000 YER to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and soft drinks. He hopes to improve his business in order to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods and snacks for his business

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en:
Majlinda is 36 years old and a Roma woman from one of the vulnerable ethnic minority communities of Albania. She lives on the outskirts of a major city where most of her community lives. She is married and has two children, nine and four years old. Her husband is on disability assistance. Thus, she is the only one to support all of them.

Majlinda has been working in a sewing factory for the past six years. After work, she comes home and does more work that her employer has given her. This has given her the opportunity to put food on the table for her family. However, there are often disruptions at work, and she and others have been sent home with no wages at all. This is the reason she wants to work for herself, in addition to what she has been doing so far for her employer. And for this, she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials and fabric.

She acknowledges that without the Kiva lenders’ support, she would not be able to buy what she has planned to. And for this, she is seeking the lenders’ kind consideration.

loans.use: To buy fabric so she can work for herself at home.

loans.name: Jose Isidro

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol además trabaja como empleado vigilante de una empresa de gobierno, este trabajo lo tiene desde hace cinco años y el cultivo de maíz y de frijol desde hace 15 años, trabajandolos desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde en la temporada, el contrata personas para que realicen el trabajo y él se encarga solamente de controlar que lo estén realizando bien, ya que por su trabajo no le queda suficiente tiempo, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad.

El solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra del abono, los herbicidas e insecticidas que son, los necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo del maíz y del frijol ya que le previenen las plagas, este préstamo le va a ayudar  económicamente para que él esté preparado y pueda iniciar su trabajo agrícola.

El objetivo de José es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y continuar trabajando como empleado y al mismo tiempo realizar siempre las actividades agrícolas ya que esto le permite una mejor condición con su familia.
texts.en: José grows sweetcorn and black beans. He also works as a security guard for a government-owned corporation. He has been a security guard for 5 years and a farmer for 15. He works from six in the morning to three in the afternoon. He hires farm hands to work on the land since his job does not leave him time to do this himself: instead, he oversees their work to make sure it is done well. José lives with his wife and two children aged 6 and 8. He asks for a loan to be able to buy fertiliser, herbicide, and insecticide, all necessary to grow sweetcorn and black beans, since they prevent plagues. This loan will help José economically, enabling him to be prepared and start farming. José's goal is to support his children through their studies and to keep working as an employee while continuing to exploit his farm, since this gives him and his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, herbicide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Together As One group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone (their loan officer, Edward, is on the left). They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a 2,500,000 SLL loan that will break down to 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Kumba is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a medical technician, and they have five children, two of whom are attending school. For the past ten years Kumba has sold cigarettes, milk, toothpaste, toothbrushes, batteries, shoe polish, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in larger quantities to add to her existing stock.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, milk, tooth-pastes, tooth-brushes, batteries, shoe polishes, etc. in larger quantity to add to her existing stock

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula is married with eight children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a bakery business and has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more flour, cooking oil and charcoal.

She has been in this business for four years and sells to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of commodities. Zula hopes to see her business grow bigger so that she owns a fully stocked bakery and to build her own house and to educate her children up to university. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more flour, cooking oil and charcoal

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member,a young brother. 

She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves. She generates additional income through her food stall.  Alice works seven days a week and works on all categories of people.  Her major business challenges are off-and-on electricity and seasonality. 

Alice aspires to see her business grow big, so that she owns a fully stocked beauty salon.  She also hopes to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, utility bills, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, who are still in school.  She has been pursuing two different businesses, selling charcoal and selling vegetables in the evenings. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling vegetables.  She also bought more sacks of charcoal  and a sofa set. She repaid the loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, more vegetables, and a table for home use. Her dream is to one day be able to extend her businesses.

Zena will share this loan with her loan group, "Tupendane C," with 18 members, who hold one other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal, vegetables, and a table for home use.

loans.name: Aleksander

texts.en:
Aleksander is a 27-year-old Romani man from the vulnerable communities of Albania. He is married and has four children, all very.  He has been the only one to financially support not only his immediate family, but also his parents, who are sick, and his sister’s education, also.  He has had to work very hard to provide for all.  

Aleksander has worked at a car wash station during the day for the past five years.   In the evenings, he has been distributing merchandise in the villages around the city for almost a year now.

The old vehicle that he used to deliver the merchandise required service all the time, and it cost him so much to repair. Now he is planning to buy a cheap used vehicle, yet in a better condition than the one he currently owes. 

He wants to grow his business to employ his younger brothers as well.   When he learned that he could request a KIVA loan via VisionFund Albania, Aleksander became extremely happy.

loans.use: To buy a used vehicle

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is married with two children, and both of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for ten years. Edith has applied for a loan of 400000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works six days a week, working at the market and also selling to all categories of people but on retail. Her major business challenges include increasing prices of bales of clothes and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her. Edith aspires to see her business grow so that she can start importing used clothes and build her own house. She resides in a rented two-room house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Aiah J.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org. based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to seek a loan of 4,400,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to invest or buy things that they cannot invest in or buy on their salaries alone. At the end of each month, these teachers will be able to repay the loan easily, using their monthly salaries.
Aiah (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Jaima, the 45-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has three children who are in primary schools. Aiah has served in the teaching profession for ten years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will use his loan to buy seeds and hire labor.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture (buy seeds and hire labor).

loans.name: Amos' Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for making the deductions and repayments on their behalf.
Amos is the leader of this group. He is 49 years old and a native of Mononya in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is divorced and has three children, one of whom is in college. Amos has served in the teaching profession for four years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay for higher education expenditure.

loans.name: Assa

texts.en:
Assa is married with three children, only one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister’s daughter). Assa resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.   
Assa has a business selling crafts and has been in this business for five years. Assa has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, to buy more crafts such as mats, tablecloths and baskets. 
Besides this crafts business, Assa also generates additional income through cattle rearing. Her major business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to see her business grow so that she can start exporting crafts to the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy more mats, tablecloths and baskets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sahr's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers from the city of Koidu, in Eastern Sierra Leone. Their leader is 51 year old Sahr, who is pictured on the left. 
 
They came to Kiva through SMT to request for a loan of 6,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones.  With this loan, they will be empowered to tackle financial constrains that they wouldn't otherwise be able to tackle with the monthly salaries.
 
Sahr has been in the teaching profession for 28 years.  He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school.  Sahr has requested a loan to buy household furniture for his home.

loans.use: to buy household furniture.

loans.name: Fatbardha

texts.en:
Fatbardha, 44 years old, is married and has two young children.  Both attending public primary school.   Her family lives on the outskirts of a major city in the southeastern part of Albania. 

She has owned a carpentry shop for the past 12 years and has been able to establish a steady clientele through the years.  Her services have been in high demand lately.  This is happening because natives who had immigrated to Greece are coming back home and are investing their money in building houses and business.

Fatbardha is applying for a Kiva loan now through VisionFund Albania to purchase woody substances, in order to fulfill clients’ needs.  She wants to thank all lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase woody substances.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is 46 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Avei needs a loan to buy barbed wire fence, a wheelbarrow, bush-knives and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Avei will use the profits from her sales to expand their house.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire fence, wheelbarrow, bush-knives and chemicals.

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en:
Faasulu is 30 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Faasulu needs a loan to buy a watering can, barbed wire, a spade, a wheelbarrow and manure/chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Faasulu will use the profits from her sales to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a watering can, barbed wire, a spade, a wheelbarrow and manure/chemicals

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en:
Tiresa is 40 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers and taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Tiresa needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, manure/chemicals, a wheelbarrow, barbed wire and a rake. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. Tiresa will use the profits from her sales to help her kids' education and her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, manure/chemicals, a wheelbarrow, barbed wire and a rake

loans.name: Sahr M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to Kiva to request a loan of 3,500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones to meet their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Sahr (who is picture on the right) is the leader of the group.  A native of Bandasuma, the 48 year old man is married to a trader and the couple has four children – two in primary school, one in secondary and one not of school age. 

Sahr has been a teacher for 18 years.  He has requested a loan to pay school fees for his children and use the rest to buy house building materials like cements, iron corrugated zincs for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and use the rest to buy house building materials.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius is a single mother of seven school age children. 

She sells used clothes and has been in business for 15 years.  She has applied for a loan of 500000 from MCDTSACCO to buy bales of used clothes.  Medius works six days a week at the market. She sells to all categories of people but on wholesale.  Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. 

Medius hopes to see her business grow, wants to start importing used clothes from Mombasa and buy a plot of land to build her own house.  She resides in a two roomed house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Neva

texts.en:
Neva is a 26-year-old married woman with three children. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Neva has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a watering can, bush-knives, barbed wire and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Neva will spend her profits to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a watering can, bush-knives, barbed wire and a spade

loans.name: Toaiva

texts.en: Toaiva is 37 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar and baking equipment. In the future, Toaiva hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and baking equipment

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 42 years old, married and has a ten-year-old son. She started her sari-sari store business in Baclayon, Bohol, ten years ago. This is her livelihood and she also helps her husband, who is a tricycle driver.  
Annabel is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, candies, snack food, toiletries, canned goods and rice. She is confident that by doing this, her business will improve its profitability. The additional income will go toward her family's daily needs, possible new business opportunities and school fees for her son.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candies, snack food, toiletries, canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. She has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has run this business for five years. 
Angie has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Angie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so that she can educate her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned good, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maybelle

texts.en:
Maybelle is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Maybelle  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. In addition to this, she also sells body lotions and vegetables. Maybelle has run this business for five years. 
Maybelle has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tauleva

texts.en: Tauleva is 37 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows taros and bananas, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been running this business for three years. Tauleva needs a loan to purchase new equipment to improve her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Tauleva will use the profits from her sales to help her with her children's schooling and home improvement.

loans.use: to buy new resources for the plantation such as more taro roots, fertilizers and chemicals, and tools such as a wheelbarrow, knives, planting tools and rakes.

loans.name: Mohamed K.'s Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of the group.  A native of Deyoh village in Eastern Sierra Leone, the 52 year old is married to a farmer and the couple has four children – two attending primary and secondary schools and two are not of school going age.  Mohamed has served in the teaching profession for 25 years.

Both group members are teachers at a primary school in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. 

This group came to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to request a loan of 2,900,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their  immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.  Their school’s bursar (a senior professional financial administrator in a school) is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf.

With the help of this loan, Mohamed is going to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is a single lady with no children, though she takes care of additional family members (two of her late sister’s children). 

She has a retail shop and has been in this business for four years.  Eva works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of 300000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt and 50kgs of sugar.  

Eva sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family. 

Eve’s major business challenges include defaulters and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  She aspires to grow he business big so that she owns a fully stocked shop, and to become wholesaler.  She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water

loans.use: to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the bakery.

loans.name: Logologo

texts.en:
Logologo is a 33-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Logologo has requested a loan to help her improve and develop her plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Logologo hopes to expand her business and to earn good income for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her plantation such as rakes, bush-knives, planting tools, chemicals, fertilisers, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more empty bottles to re-sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
